Remove pathlib2 from global requirements

This is only referenced in some files in upstream-institute.

Change-Id: I93cc0e6490d38b547f9e707750d3ced1d9e8774c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-28 21:59:13.000000000', 'message': "Refactor upgrade prepare and converge.

As we aren't required to re-deploy any more during the converge step
the actions performed by the Upgrade Converge and Prepare are exactly
the same, the only difference is the lifecycle environment file we
use to set and unset parameters.

This patch refactors both classes, the UpgradePrepare and UpgradeConverge
clasess:

- UpgradePrepare: Stop forcing update-plan-only and then try to do most of the
actions from deployment into UpgradePrepare. This change will force config_download
to false (which will avoid running the full deployment and do only an stack update)
and lastly enable ssh into overcloud nodes, as that part is perforemd in deployment
only if config_download is set to true. Add new attributes to UpgradePrepare so we
can override them in UpgradeConverge via inheritence.

- UpgradeConverge: Inherit from UpgradePrepare instead of DeployOvercloud. Set the
right value for the class attributes and let UpgradePrepare class do all the magic.
This patch also changes the class name to be in consonancy with the rest of the
clases.

Change-Id: I6148511eb6ad1e3798a7bf40c721824830c7073d
(cherry picked from commit 8df46e3798f3a5b3e2350fd95343eada9fcd1917)

commit_message:
Refactor upgrade prepare and converge.

As we aren't required to re-deploy any more during the converge step
the actions performed by the Upgrade Converge and Prepare are exactly
the same, the only difference is the lifecycle environment file we
use to set and unset parameters.

This patch refactors both classes, the UpgradePrepare and UpgradeConverge
clasess:

- UpgradePrepare: Stop forcing update-plan-only and then try to do most of the
actions from deployment into UpgradePrepare. This change will force config_download
to false (which will avoid running the full deployment and do only an stack update),
then download the config by invoking get_config from package_update and lastly
enable ssh into overcloud nodes, as that part is perforemd in deployment only if
config_download is set to true. Add new attributes to UpgradePrepare so we can
override them in UpgradeConverge via inheritence.

- UpgradeConverge: Inherit from UpgradePrepare instead of DeployOvercloud. Set the
right value for the class attributes and let UpgradePrepare class do all the magic.

Change-Id: I6148511eb6ad1e3798a7bf40c721824830c7073d
(cherry picked from commit 8df46e3798f3a5b3e2350fd95343eada9fcd1917)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 22:42:22.000000000', 'message': "Bump up probe test timeout

There's been a roughly 5x increase in timeouts in the last three months,
which was itself about a 10x increase from the three months prior. Let's
get timeouts to be the exception, not the norm.

FWIW, some stats over the past two and a half years:

  Quarter | Median    | Timeouts
          | Pass Time |
  --------+-----------+---------
   2018Q1 |     19.0m |        2
   2018Q2 |     24.5m |       19
   2018Q3 |     26.8m |        3
   2018Q4 |     29.0m |        2
   2019Q1 |     31.0m |        0
   2019Q2 |     31.7m |        4
   2019Q3 |     32.7m |        1
   2019Q4 |     33.7m |        2
   2020Q1 |     46.4m |       25
   2020Q2 |     47.5m |      134

Change-Id: Iab60b952dfd1060f1166e5a07c9298c75e6831f1
"}]
commit_message:
Bump up probe test timeout

There's been a roughly 5x increase in timeouts in the last three months,
which was itself about a 10x increase from the three months prior. Let's
get timeouts to be the exception, not the norm.

FWIW, some stats over the past two and a half years:

  Quarter | Median    | Timeouts
          | Pass Time |
  --------+-----------+---------
   2018Q1 |     19.0m |        2
   2018Q2 |     24.5m |       19
   2018Q3 |     26.8m |        3
   2018Q4 |     29.0m |        2
   2019Q1 |     31.0m |        0
   2019Q2 |     31.7m |        4
   2019Q3 |     32.7m |        1
   2019Q4 |     33.7m |        2
   2020Q1 |     46.4m |       25
   2020Q2 |     47.5m |      134

Change-Id: Iab60b952dfd1060f1166e5a07c9298c75e6831f1

Create module_utils/container_configs

Move some functions under its own utils for later re-use when we'll
create a new module that will manage container startup configs.

Change-Id: I48c04b38d91b057f5bd6796ea008197a8114a159

commit_message:
tests: Split instance NUMA object tests

Do what we did for the InstanceNUMA objects as we did for (host) NUMA
objects in change Ib59970cce77d0276a53cfee6ff07ff64347673fc.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: I93254c6960ac5116af8f5202d05b859a656a8acf
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-06-19 16:03:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the wrong value for QoS rate conversion to bytes/s

The rate value is converted to bytes per second before being
sent to Pyroute2, but it used the wrong value for the calculations.
This resulted in incorrect rates.
It should be multiplied by 1000 (kbit), not 1024 (Kibit).
The same applies to the burst value.

commit_message:
Fix the wrong value for QoS rate conversion to bytes/s

The rate value is converted to bytes per second before being
sent to Pyroute2, but it used the wrong value for the calculations.
This resulted in incorrect rates.
It should be multiplied by 1000 (kbit), not 1024 (Kibit).
The same applies to the burst value (kb).

Change-Id: I70cb1fe651a50b2f6495d7a365a6beb2ba111c6d
Closes-Bug: #1884273

I like this change but I prefer to make validation at flavor creation rather than instance booting if I understand correctly.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-06-20 17:18:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Andrey: The realtime mask can be specified in either the flavor or the image, and the details may be hypervisor-specific.

Personally for instance boot I'd like to see an early validation phase for image/flavor metadata in nova-api, and then another hypervisor-specific validation in nova-compute.  That would let us fail as early as possible."}, {'account_id': 21813, 'date': '2017-06-20 19:46:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> Personally for instance boot ...

Ok, I see. Would you update this patch or make follow-ups?'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2017-06-20 19:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I view generic flavor/image metadata validation as essentially a feature in and of itself, so I don't think it makes sense to do it as part of this patch. I agree that the code currently supports cpu_realtime_mask starting without ^.

However, when I read the libvirt-real-time spec[1],
I got the impression that it did NOT support the syntax starting without ^,
and got the impression that users had to use cpu_realtime_mask starting with ^.

So, it makes sense that the test cases whose hw:cpu_realtime_mask starts 
without ^ should be called "mask_badly_configured" or something like that.

IMO, this patch should...
1. ensure that when using RT, at least we have 1vCPU for RT and 1 for non-RT.
2. ensure that hw:cpu_realtime_mask starts with ^.

And another patch would rename cpu_realtime_mask to cpu_realtime_set, 
accept the syntax starting without ^, and may contain documents for clarity.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/mitaka/implemented/libvirt-real-time.html'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-10-03 10:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-10-03 10:28:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

The -1 is for test renaming, but I'm +2 on this and the follow up once that's done"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-10-03 19:53:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

The RT vCPU mask stuff is confusing already because it's a double-negative. In other words, by the metadata key being called a "mask", it implies that the contents of the metadata value represents a set of vCPUs that SHOULD NOT be used for realtime processes.

But requiring a carat at the start of the cpu_realtime_mask metadata value is even MORE confusing because carat indicates the xor of a set. So, having a cpu_realtime_mask of "^0-1" reads as "use anything but the first and second vCPUs as the vCPUs that SHOULD NOT be realtime". Which is the opposite of what actually happens.

In any case, I actually do NOT think that the solution here is to change the hw:cpu_realtime_mask metadata item at all.

My recommendation would be to deprecate this metadata item and create a new metadata item called "hw:realtime_cpu_set". The value of this metadata item would be a "CPU set spec", of the format detailed here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/hardware.py#L57

At that point, users could do stuff like set hw:realtime_cpu_set to "0-3,^1" if they really wanted to, and that would mean "The first, third and fourth vCPUs of this flavor should be used for realtime".

So, in short, I don't think we should go forward with this patch or series and instead do it correctly with metadata key names and values that are not confusing.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-04 14:53:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I agree. If there is a problem with the name of this option or the syntax we should fix the whole. No need to add more code to achieve the same result when we can see that the first implementation brought bugs.

That is said you can still fix the two bugs which are the 'strip', and the out of range possibility of the mask."}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-10-04 14:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck-zkvm'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-04 18:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2020-06-18 15:00:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

So this and the patch on top are just to make the realtime CPU mask consistent with the future cpu_dedicated_mask, right?

I don't think they belong in this series. We should have a separate plan/spec/series for making the realtime mask behave in a reasonable way, which includes what happens with existing instances that are using the mask in the wrong way.

Part of the reason I'm saying is that - I don't like the proposal for cpu_dedicated_mask. If it's a mask, then we should strictly enforce its "maskness", and make sure it starts with a ^. The current "guess the intention" behaviour that's proposed a few patches up is asking for trouble.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-19 12:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> So this and the patch on top are just to make the realtime CPU mask
 > consistent with the future cpu_dedicated_mask, right?

Yes and no. The bugfix (to correctly validate the value) is here because I'm reworking the surrounding code and want to get this in before I do so (to ease backporting). Similarly, the general restructuring of the code (merging functions) is intended to make the later patches in the series easier to grok. The two "features" (ability to omit 'hw:cpu_realtime_mask' if an emulator thread policy is used, and ability to omit the leading carat from 'hw:cpu_realtime_mask' and get sane behavior) are to align better to 'hw:cpu_dedicated_mask' though, yes, and could be dropped if necessary. I've restructured things so we could do that. With that said...

 > I don't think they belong in this series. We should have a separate
 > plan/spec/series for making the realtime mask behave in a
 > reasonable way, which includes what happens with existing instances
 > that are using the mask in the wrong way.

I've made the case again in the next patch that these aren't currently being used incorrectly. This is incredibly unlikely to be used and would mean users are relying on a nova bug. I don't think that's something we should support.

 > Part of the reason I'm saying is that - I don't like the proposal
 > for cpu_dedicated_mask. If it's a mask, then we should strictly
 > enforce its "maskness", and make sure it starts with a ^. The
 > current "guess the intention" behaviour that's proposed a few
 > patches up is asking for trouble.

As above. I have restructured the order of patches so that they could be dragged out now if necessary, but I'd much rather keep them since I don't think there's any risk here and this is the correct thing to do.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-06-19 15:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2020-06-19 15:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

commit_message:
hardware: Add validation for 'cpu_realtime_mask'

It's possible to specify some strange values for the cpu realtime mask
and the code won't currently complain, so let's make it a bit more
strict.

Change-Id: I0ba06529affe5b48af5ac37bc24242dffdac77d3
Closes-Bug: #1884231

commit_message:
libvirt: Add typing information

As with the 'nova.virt.hardware' module, add typing information here now
so that we can use it during development of later features. This
requires some minor tweaks of code that mypy found confusing.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: Icc7b3d250bb9dd3d162731959185d9e962727247
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-11 13:28:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix a typo in the OVN manual install guide

Using a colon is not correct in this context and results in service
startup errors like this:

AttributeError: module 'neutron.services.ovn_l3'
has no attribute 'plugin:OVNL3RouterPlugin'

It could be that this hasn't been modified after copying from setup.cfg
where a colon is used correctly.

Change-Id: Id51704a50f42b65049e535aaeb9dc6847a3737bb
"}, {'created': '2020-06-15 10:27:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix a typo in the OVN manual install guide

Using a colon is not correct in this context and results in service
startup errors like this:

AttributeError: module 'neutron.services.ovn_l3'
has no attribute 'plugin:OVNL3RouterPlugin'

It could be that this hasn't been modified after copying from setup.cfg
where a colon is used correctly.

Moreover, it would be better to use entrypoint names, so this change
changes that for the L3 service plugin as well as the core plugin.

Change-Id: Id51704a50f42b65049e535aaeb9dc6847a3737bb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a typo in the OVN manual install guide

Using a colon is not correct in this context and results in service
startup errors like this:

AttributeError: module 'neutron.services.ovn_l3'
has no attribute 'plugin:OVNL3RouterPlugin'

It could be that this hasn't been modified after copying from setup.cfg
where a colon is used correctly.

Moreover, it would be better to use entrypoint names, so this change
changes that for the L3 service plugin as well as the core plugin.

Change-Id: Id51704a50f42b65049e535aaeb9dc6847a3737bb

commit_message:
hardware: Update and correct typing information

This is going to be used extensively in forthcoming patches. Lay the
groundwork now. This requires some minor tweaks of code that mypy found
confusing along with unit tests for coverage gaps it exposed.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: Ied35762c353a084398ab8032a8efe6eada69dd9b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix typo in setting octavia wsgi server name

hiera was being set as server_name when it should've been servername.

Change-Id: I08c4562308a5a5ce93e64a7485ab207af2241565
Closes-Bug: #1877130
(cherry picked from commit dac08c4f0ebc79d0003a6a4610bbc240a808da22)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 17:09:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the tls deps install task -  dependency of the tripleo-ipa

The tls dep install taks is failing sporadically on some clouds.
This taks skoudl not be needed as the deps should be installed
as a dependency of the tripleo-ipa package.

Change-Id: I6bda4f9f9208013d5e19e75ab63a443a571fc7f9
Closes-Bug: #1884570
'}, {'created': '2020-06-22 20:14:22.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the tls deps install task -  dependency of the tripleo-ipa

The tls dep install taks is failing sporadically on some clouds.
This taks skoudl not be needed as the deps should be installed
as a dependency of the tripleo-ipa package.

commit_message:
Remove the tls deps install task -  dependency of the tripleo-ipa

The tls dep install task is failing sporadically on some clouds.
This task skould not need to install all the deps as they
should be installed as a dependency of the tripleo-ipa package.

Change-Id: I6bda4f9f9208013d5e19e75ab63a443a571fc7f9
Closes-Bug: #1884570

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 09:32:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove elementtree deprecated methods

All our supported runtimes [1] are compatible with the recommended
alternatives.

`Element.getchildren` [2] is deprecated since python 3.2 and will be removed
in python 3.9, these changes switch usages to `list(elem)`.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.getchildren

Change-Id: I5264edb93532d90703ae7b59cd71520a2cd3518a
'}, {'created': '2020-06-23 11:32:51.000000000', 'message': 'Remove lxml deprecated methods

All our supported runtimes [1] are compatible with the recommended
alternatives.

The `getchildren` method is deprecated [2] since lxml 2.0 and will be removed
in future versions, these changes switch usages to `list(elem)` as
recommended in the official documentation [2].

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://lxml.de/api/lxml.etree._Element-class.html#getchildren

Change-Id: I5264edb93532d90703ae7b59cd71520a2cd3518a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove lxml deprecated methods

All our supported runtimes [1] are compatible with the recommended
alternatives.

The `getchildren` method is deprecated [2] since lxml 2.0 and will be removed
in future versions, these changes switch usages to `list(elem)` as
recommended in the official documentation [2].

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://lxml.de/api/lxml.etree._Element-class.html#getchildren

Change-Id: I5264edb93532d90703ae7b59cd71520a2cd3518a

commit_message:
Stop claiming to support Debian distros

We haven't had a working job for stretch or jessie in years, attempts
to get things fixed have been dropped, set let's be honest and drop
those from our support list.

Change-Id: Ia6152be79f8044f7ff039ec0911ad4938d6271f4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 02:11:51.000000000', 'message': 'Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: Icf6403de9655e99e1bed44ded896b1bbb2a6a635
'}]
commit_message:
Make greande jobs n-v for EM and oldest stable

As discussed in ML thread[1], we are going to
make grenade jobs as non voting for all EM stable and
oldest stable. grenade jobs are failing not and it might take
time to fix those if we are able to fix. Once it jobs are
working depends on project team, they can bring them back to
voting or keep non-voting.

If those jobs are failing consistently and no one is fixing them
then removing those n-v jobs in future also fine.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015499.html

StableOnly

Change-Id: Icf6403de9655e99e1bed44ded896b1bbb2a6a635

commit_message:
Handle force_tenant_isolation in is_admin_available()

When a test class sets force_tenant_isolation it implicitly requires
configured admin cred. So is_admin_available() which is being used
to skip tests where admin cred are needed, needs to handle
force_tenant_isolation case also and return true for force_tenant_isolation
if there are configured cred present.

This scenario is triggered when using pre-existing accounts but no admin
credentials in the [auth] setup.

Closes-Bug: 1780404
Change-Id: I33afb6f807a16c38c12a0d214c4d008407a49e4f

commit_message:
Add support for [oslo_middleware] enable_proxy_headers_parsing

The enable_proxy_haders_parsing parameter was added into Octavia[1] so
that Octavia API can set up the request URL correctly.
This patch adds support for this parameter in octaiva::api module, so
that operators can set it according to their deployment architecture.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/639736/

Change-Id: I985abb8e5dcd6d29e794b200982f8bce99ac316c
(cherry picked from commit ddc7986e1821303b5a444f993888992cf8a7dcd7)

commit_message:
Make devstack run on focal (Ubuntu LTS 20.04)

- Add a nodeset and a platform job
- Drop uwsgi-py2 pkg that no longer exists
- Blacklist tests that are currently failing

Change-Id: Ib4416dc2f5e003fd770f5240a8f78213c56af8e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 19:57:32.000000000', 'message': "Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic8246b83563444501fe6d31712ea64d39e88140d
"}]
commit_message:
Cap jsonschema 3.2.0 as the minimal version

Previous versions of jsonschema (<3.2.0) doesn't support python 3.8 [1].
Python 3.8 is part of the victoria supported runtimes [2] so we now force
to use jsonschema version 3.2.0 to avoid issues, remove ambiguity and ensure
that everything works with python 3 in general.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/pull/627
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: Ic8246b83563444501fe6d31712ea64d39e88140d

commit_message:
Adding amphora architecture to heat templates

Adding a change to the octavia deployment config to specify an amphora
architecture.  Default to x86_64.

Change-Id: I886cf9ac4d5686500da3c4412ca6fe5660a651ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-24 00:55:16.000000000', 'message': 'grafana: don't use bool for refresh

grafyaml actually knows this is deprecated, but it's actually more
than that and doesn't work to refresh the variable at all now.  "1"
means "on load" which is what we want.

Change-Id: I34ecdd30c2188cb7e6ec32e33c6a6e99b6240934
'}]
commit_message:
grafana: don't use bool for refresh

grafyaml actually knows this is deprecated, but it's actually more
than that and doesn't work to refresh the variable at all now.  "1"
means "on load" which is what we want.

Change-Id: I34ecdd30c2188cb7e6ec32e33c6a6e99b6240934

commit_message:
Use folder with plan name with config download export

To be consistent with auto config-download and overcloud export
create subfloder with plan/stack name.

Change-Id: I08b447379ae6e267f8dff11e6e703a991918683c
Closes-Bug: #1884246

The only semantic changes are actually improvements (i.e. the mutable defaults).'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-03-13 12:40:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-03-13 12:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dependency has merged, you can continue here. Let's use hacking 3.0."}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2020-05-06 19:28:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

I'm not so fond of adding the translation hook for Exceptions. It does not seem likely that anyone would ever translate them for this project.

My dev/sys experience is also that issues are more easily share about, googled an ultimately solved when Exceptions are always in the same language for everyone. 

Unless some tool or policy strictly imposes that, I'd rather prefer to keep the Exceptions as-is."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-05-18 10:17:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-05-18 13:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-05-18 14:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2020-05-25 07:50:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Somehow this comment I made has been left undiscussed:
> I'm not so fond of adding the translation hook for Exceptions. It does not seem likely that anyone would ever translate them for this p roject.
>
> My dev/sys experience is also that issues are more easily share about, googled an ultimately solved when Exceptions are always in the same language for everyone. 
>
> Unless some tool or policy strictly imposes that, I'd rather prefer to keep the Exceptions as-is.

Lajos, do you feel strongly about keeping translations for Exceptions ? or do you know about a policy imposing that to the project ?

If not, I would prefer *not* adding translations for Exceptions."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-06-08 14:06:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks Thomas, I tried to check for official doc for this, and found this one:
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/user/guidelines.html

By this don't need to translate internal exceptions but the ones that are ivsible on the API should be translated.

commit_message:
Switch to hacking 3.0.1

Make the code compatible with hacking rules:
* some mutable default arguments
* a few missing whitespace
I removed the rule N530 (Direct neutron imports not allowed), as that is
a longer story.
I removed the rule N534 (Do not allow unlocalized translations) as well.
Remove old code related to exabgp<4.0.2

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708965/
Change-Id: Ibdba7bbee0b6ec57cf8b9f0e78de8f264ceeb325

commit_message:
Update requirements to include oauthlib

This library is required for python-keystoneclient oauth resources
(e.g., consumers, request tokens, etc). Without this library, mistral
logs an error since keystoneauth treats the oauthlib library as an
optional dependency:

  Failed to create action: keystone.oauth1.consumers_build_url:
  NotImplementedError: To use 'consumers' oauthlib must be installed

This commit adds the oauthlib package to requirements.txt so that
mistral doesn't log ERRRORs building the action map.

Change-Id: Ib172dd8fb122696072c38e9c78e0e07b5e38f222

commit_message:
openstack: move all openstack projects to dedicated acl

This change makes all projects namespaced inside OpenStack to use a
different ACL than the default one provided by OpenDev.

Change-Id: I87d4946704c00994b92ebdb2ba2b78505c89d8ba

commit_message:
Move retired.config to external namespace

The retired.config is aimed for all tenants of OpenDev, there's no need
for it to live inside OpenStack.

Change-Id: I98cffdb966548544b53cf367d5048c5a2503f060

commit_message:
Update constraints for eventlet to v0.21.0

Eventlet v0.20.0 is affected by [0] on Python 3.6 causing
neutron-rpc-server to fail with SSL enabled. The issue is
fixed in v0.21.0

Though issue affects Python 3.6 and above, there's a value
to try keeping its version consistent among all Python
versions.

[0] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/371

Closes-Bug: #1884808
Change-Id: I9c8e226166358c7d4e3b5cd57512ac08497aee02
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

Update MANIFEST for dashboard config

The various policy files in openstack-dashboard/conf are not
included in the package by default. Update MANIFEST.in to
recursively include that directory.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-27 18:45:01.000000000', 'message': "[DVR] Reconfigure re-created physical bridges for dvr routers

In case when physical bridge is removed and created again it
is initialized by neutron-ovs-agent.
But if agent has enabled distributed routing, dvr related
flows wasn't configured again and that lead to connectivity issues
in case of DVR routers.

This patch fixes it by adding configuration of dvr related flows
if distributed routing is enabled in agent's configuration.

It also adds reset list of phys_brs in dvr_agent. Without that there
were different objects used in ovs agent and dvr_agent classes thus
e.g. 2 various cookie ids were set on flows in physical bridge.
This was also the same issue in case when openvswitch was restarted and
all bridges were reconfigured.
Now in such case there is correctly new cookie_id configured for all
flows.

Change-Id: I710f00f0f542bcf7fa2fc60800797b90f9f77e14
Closes-Bug: #1864822
(cherry picked from commit 91f0bf3c8511bf3b0cc63746f767d8d4dce601bd)
"}, {'created': '2020-05-27 20:16:10.000000000', 'message': "[DVR] Reconfigure re-created physical bridges for dvr routers

In case when physical bridge is removed and created again it
is initialized by neutron-ovs-agent.
But if agent has enabled distributed routing, dvr related
flows wasn't configured again and that lead to connectivity issues
in case of DVR routers.

This patch fixes it by adding configuration of dvr related flows
if distributed routing is enabled in agent's configuration.

It also adds reset list of phys_brs in dvr_agent. Without that there
were different objects used in ovs agent and dvr_agent classes thus
e.g. 2 various cookie ids were set on flows in physical bridge.
This was also the same issue in case when openvswitch was restarted and
all bridges were reconfigured.
Now in such case there is correctly new cookie_id configured for all
flows.

Change-Id: I710f00f0f542bcf7fa2fc60800797b90f9f77e14
Closes-Bug: #1864822
(cherry picked from commit 91f0bf3c8511bf3b0cc63746f767d8d4dce601bd)
"}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Reconfigure re-created physical bridges for dvr routers

In case when physical bridge is removed and created again it
is initialized by neutron-ovs-agent.
But if agent has enabled distributed routing, dvr related
flows wasn't configured again and that lead to connectivity issues
in case of DVR routers.

This patch fixes it by adding configuration of dvr related flows
if distributed routing is enabled in agent's configuration.

It also adds reset list of phys_brs in dvr_agent. Without that there
were different objects used in ovs agent and dvr_agent classes thus
e.g. 2 various cookie ids were set on flows in physical bridge.
This was also the same issue in case when openvswitch was restarted and
all bridges were reconfigured.
Now in such case there is correctly new cookie_id configured for all
flows.

Change-Id: I710f00f0f542bcf7fa2fc60800797b90f9f77e14
Closes-Bug: #1864822
(cherry picked from commit 91f0bf3c8511bf3b0cc63746f767d8d4dce601bd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 09:49:00.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Make QoS OVS agent deletion operations more resilient

When a Port is deleted, the QoS extension will reset any rule (QoS
and Queue registers) applied on this port or will reset the
related Interface policing parameters.

If the Port and the related Interface are deleted during the QoS
extension operation, those commands will fail. This patch makes those
operations more resiliant by not checking the errors when writing on
the Port or the Interface register.

Change-Id: I2cc4cdf5be25fab6adbc64acabb3fffebb693fa6
Closes-Bug: #1884512
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS] Make QoS OVS agent deletion operations more resilient

When a Port is deleted, the QoS extension will reset any rule (QoS
and Queue registers) applied on this port or will reset the
related Interface policing parameters.

If the Port and the related Interface are deleted during the QoS
extension operation, those commands will fail. This patch makes those
operations more resiliant by not checking the errors when writing on
the Port or the Interface register.

Change-Id: I2cc4cdf5be25fab6adbc64acabb3fffebb693fa6
Closes-Bug: #1884512

commit_message:
Use python3 pip module instead of pip binary

Focal only provides a pip3 binary, no pip3.8. Instead of working around
that with a symlink, use the module instead.

Add version information output for this variant.

Change-Id: I7af194ecc40e4d43c10ce067a661bb6ab4ca37d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-18 20:40:49.000000000', 'message': 'Update os-brick library to 2.10.4

The previous version contained a regression that affected operation
when running under Python 2.7 while using the Dell EMC VxFlex OS
(ScaleIO) storage backend.

Change-Id: Ib2ae9b847b2966d84e33f530e5fd2b46fc755a27
'}]
commit_message:
Update os-brick library to 2.10.4

The previous version contained a regression that affected operation
when running under Python 2.7 while using the Dell EMC VxFlex OS
(ScaleIO) storage backend.

Change-Id: Ib2ae9b847b2966d84e33f530e5fd2b46fc755a27

subject: Fix Invalid() exception msg

commit_message:
Prevent raising exception if IP address is set in _hotplug_server

In "_hotplug_server", when the new interfaces is added to the server,
the function tries to configure the Neutron assigned IP address in
this new interface. Although the IP addresses are listed before to
check that the new port IP is not present, as reported in the bug,
sometimes the address is already set when the "ip a add" command is
executed.

Change-Id: I9594482735b482eb477f342dfd9f265a41eb002d
Closes-Bug: #1869899

commit_message:
Update constraint for neutron-lib to new release 2.4.0

neutron-lib 2.4.0 was releaesd in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/735687/
but somehow we cannot find a patch to update upper-constraints for it.
I am manually proposing it.

Change-Id: Ic1ab7927a5a863a099055b46d0cb2a6f99551472

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 23:14:59.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Add a placement audit command

There are different situations when allocations can be orphaned.
Adding a new nova-manage command to lookup at all resource providers
and check against the related compute nodes whether they have
orphaned allocations.

NOTE(artom) Conflicts and notes:

* The big one is conflicts caused by 6b6d81cf2b and the
  bp/placement-mirror-host-aggregates series being absent in queens.
  Git gets tremendously confused about the absence of that code around
  this backport's additions, but all the conflicts actually have an
  easy manual resolution: don't include any of the surrounding code
  in this backport. The ResourceProviderNotFound exception is - wait
  for it - an exception, and it's included here.

* Test inheritance had to be adjusted because in queens the
  ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is in
  nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py and not
  nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py

* mock, collections, oslo_serialization jsonutils, and fake_requests
  imports had to be added.

* ResourceClass is in nova/objects/fields.py instead of its own
  nova/rc_fields. Adjust the import.

* To get get_allocations_for_consumer() to include the entire JSON
  response, the include_project_user param is used instead of its
  future replacement, include_generation.

* The ALLOCATION_PROJECT_USER placement API microversion is used
  instead of CONSUMER_GENERATION_VERSION, which doesn't exist yet.

Change-Id: I537ed74503d208957f0a97af3ab754a6750dac20
Closes-Bug: #1793569
(cherry picked from commit c03716be1f3e9fd5a5e9adf95860c7ce4bfe211f)

commit_message:
DNM: Add a placement audit command

There are different situations when allocations can be orphaned.
Adding a new nova-manage command to lookup at all resource providers
and check against the related compute nodes whether they have
orphaned allocations.

NOTE(artom) Conflicts and notes:

* The big one is conflicts caused by 6b6d81cf2b and the
  bp/placement-mirror-host-aggregates series being absent in queens.
  Git gets tremendously confused about the absence of that code around
  this backport's additions, but all the conflicts actually have an
  easy manual resolution: don't include any of the surrounding code
  in this backport. The ResourceProviderNotFound exception is - wait
  for it - an exception, and it's included here.

* Test inheritance had to be adjusted because in queens the
  ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is in
  nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py and not
  nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py

* mock, collections, oslo_serialization jsonutils, and fake_requests
  imports had to be added.

* ResourceClass is in nova/objects/fields.py instead of its own
  nova/rc_fields. Adjust the import.

* To get get_allocations_for_consumer() to include the entire JSON
  response, the include_project_user param is used instead of its
  future replacement, include_generation.

* The ALLOCATION_PROJECT_USER placement API microversion is used
  instead of CONSUMER_GENERATION_VERSION, which doesn't exist yet.

Change-Id: I537ed74503d208957f0a97af3ab754a6750dac20
Closes-Bug: #1793569
(cherry picked from commit c03716be1f3e9fd5a5e9adf95860c7ce4bfe211f)
(cherry picked from commit 5994f6cdc15972cfe6ae89f3eef49d95ee7786b7)
(cherry picked from commit 1867bb8fb79332e911c30e688540ae48637c0e45)

commit_message:
DNM: Partial cherry-pick of report client changes

This is a stable-only patial cherry-pick of the report client changes
(and associated test changes) from 6b6d81cf2b. It mainly gives us the
include_project_user param to get_allocations_for_consumer(), which
makes the latter return the full JSON response, not just the
allocations. This will be used in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Iad8b452cd23920549980ec5e529099e1935a0049
(cherry picked from commit 6b6d81cf2b4600bafaca05117c079e8a1d240756)

commit_message:
DNM: Don't heal allocations for deleted servers

InstanceList.get_by_filters by default returns deleted
servers, which we don't want to heal, so this adds the
missing filter along with a functional test to show
this working as expected.

Change-Id: Ic18b3ea5c7db5a0535488498b4e330803e0635b5
Closes-Bug: #1776743
(cherry picked from commit c8d5a71da69512c272c6106e837a7f2ffac87032)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 21:12:50.000000000', 'message': "DNM: Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI

This adds a new CLI which will iterate all non-cell0
cells looking for instances that (1) have a host,
(2) aren't undergoing a task state transition and
(3) don't have allocations in placement and try
to allocate resources, based on the instance embedded
flavor, against the compute node resource provider
on which the instance is currently running.

This is meant as a way to help migrate CachingScheduler
users off the CachingScheduler by first shoring up
instance allocations in placement for any instances
created after Pike, when the nova-compute resource
tracker code stopped creating allocations in placement
since the FilterScheduler does it at the time of
scheduling (but the CachingScheduler doesn't).

This will be useful beyond just getting deployments
off the CachingScheduler, however, since operators
will be able to use it to fix incorrect allocations
resulting from failed operations.

There are several TODOs and NOTEs inline about things
we could build on top of this or improve, but for now
this is the basic idea.

NOTE(artom) Trivial-ish conflicts in nova/exception.py due to
different exceptions around the newly added one.

Change-Id: Iab67fd56ab4845f8ee19ca36e7353730638efb21
(cherry picked from commit 95106d2fa1ab86607231c338fa0abc0c3488f0f8)
"}]
commit_message:
DNM: Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI

This adds a new CLI which will iterate all non-cell0
cells looking for instances that (1) have a host,
(2) aren't undergoing a task state transition and
(3) don't have allocations in placement and try
to allocate resources, based on the instance embedded
flavor, against the compute node resource provider
on which the instance is currently running.

This is meant as a way to help migrate CachingScheduler
users off the CachingScheduler by first shoring up
instance allocations in placement for any instances
created after Pike, when the nova-compute resource
tracker code stopped creating allocations in placement
since the FilterScheduler does it at the time of
scheduling (but the CachingScheduler doesn't).

This will be useful beyond just getting deployments
off the CachingScheduler, however, since operators
will be able to use it to fix incorrect allocations
resulting from failed operations.

There are several TODOs and NOTEs inline about things
we could build on top of this or improve, but for now
this is the basic idea.

NOTE(artom) Trivial-ish conflicts in nova/exception.py due to
different exceptions around the newly added one.

Change-Id: Iab67fd56ab4845f8ee19ca36e7353730638efb21
(cherry picked from commit 95106d2fa1ab86607231c338fa0abc0c3488f0f8)

commit_message:
DNM: Partial cherry-pick of assertRequestMatchesUsage()

This is a downstream-only partial cherry-pick of the
assertRequestMatchesUsage() method from 94e620e87c. It will be used in
a subsequent patch.

NOTE(artom) Nested resource providers are not a thing in queens, so
that logic in assertRequestMatchesUsage(), as well as the
_get_all_rp_uuids_in_a_tree() helper, get disappeared.

Conflicts because in queens the ProviderUsageBaseTestCase is in
nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py and not
nova/tests/functional/integrated_helpers.py

Change-Id: I3c783eba5a224c889c058ba6ddd8681024e7f078
(cherry picked from commit 18b0e8dd24ddcfc77a5d7124593c7c7c0b72ad03)

[{'created': '2020-04-17 21:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Add a placement audit command

There are different situations when allocations can be orphaned.
Adding a new nova-manage command to lookup at all resource providers
and check against the related compute nodes whether they have
orphaned allocations.

NOTE(artom) The following changes had to be made, mostly in
nova/cmd/manage.py.

* os_resoure_classes did not exist in rocky, it is replaced with
  nova.rc_fields.ResourceClass

* The NET_BW_* and PCPU resource classes are part of the
  bandwidth resource provider series (bp/bandwidth-resource-provider)
  and CPU resource series (bp/cpu-resources), which landed in stein
  and train respectively. They are removed.

* As is_cell_failure_sentinel() only appeared in 031314b6d8, use
  context.raised_exception_sentinel instead.

* In rocky get_allocations_for_resource_provider() returns the JSON
  allocations directly, code that uses its return value had to be
  adjusted, as well as the the
  test_check_orphaned_allocations_for_provider() code that mocks it.

* In rocky get_allocs_for_consumer() did not exist yet - switch to
  using get_allocations_for_consumer().

* In rocky delete_allocation_for_instance() does not accept a
  consumer_type param, cannot raise anything, and directly returns
  True or False. Adjust the code that calls it accordingly.

* A new stable-only put_allocs() method was necessary because the
  existing put_allocations() in rocky does not allow us to remove
  resource providers from the request.

* The ProviderAllocInfo namedtuple from f534495a42
  had to be included in the backport because the unit tests need it.

commit_message:
DNM: Add a placement audit command

There are different situations when allocations can be orphaned.
Adding a new nova-manage command to lookup at all resource providers
and check against the related compute nodes whether they have
orphaned allocations.

NOTE(artom) The following changes had to be made, mostly in
nova/cmd/manage.py.

* os_resoure_classes did not exist in rocky, it is replaced with
  nova.rc_fields.ResourceClass

* The NET_BW_* and PCPU resource classes are part of the
  bandwidth resource provider series (bp/bandwidth-resource-provider)
  and CPU resource series (bp/cpu-resources), which landed in stein
  and train respectively. They are removed.

* As is_cell_failure_sentinel() only appeared in 031314b6d8, use
  context.raised_exception_sentinel instead.

* In rocky get_allocations_for_resource_provider() returns the JSON
  allocations directly, code that uses its return value had to be
  adjusted, as well as the the
  test_check_orphaned_allocations_for_provider() code that mocks it.

* In rocky get_allocs_for_consumer() did not exist yet - switch to
  using get_allocations_for_consumer().

* In rocky delete_allocation_for_instance() does not accept a
  consumer_type param, cannot raise anything, and directly returns
  True or False. Adjust the code that calls it accordingly.

* The stable-only put_allocs() method from the stein backport is
  modified to take into account put_allocations()'s inability to
  raise. It not just return True or False based on the HTTP code from
  placement.

* The ProviderAllocInfo namedtuple from f534495a42
  had to be included in the backport because the unit tests need it.

Change-Id: I537ed74503d208957f0a97af3ab754a6750dac20
Closes-Bug: #1793569
(cherry picked from commit c03716be1f3e9fd5a5e9adf95860c7ce4bfe211f)
(cherry picked from commit 5994f6cdc15972cfe6ae89f3eef49d95ee7786b7)

commit_message:
DNM: Add a placement audit command

There are different situations when allocations can be orphaned.
Adding a new nova-manage command to lookup at all resource providers
and check against the related compute nodes whether they have
orphaned allocations.

NOTE(artom) Notes about nova/cmd/manage.py:

* Trivial conflict due to imports

* collections was missing from imports and had to be added

* The trait MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT was introduced by the AMD-SEV
  series (bp/amd-sev-libvirt-support), did not exist in stein, and had
  to be removed.

* A new stable-only put_allocs() method was necessary because the
  existing put_allocations() in stein does not allow us to remove
  resource providers from the request.

Change-Id: I537ed74503d208957f0a97af3ab754a6750dac20
Closes-Bug: #1793569
(cherry picked from commit c03716be1f3e9fd5a5e9adf95860c7ce4bfe211f)
(cherry picked from commit 5994f6cdc15972cfe6ae89f3eef49d95ee7786b7)

commit_message:
DNM: Add a placement audit command

There are different situations when allocations can be orphaned.
Adding a new nova-manage command to lookup at all resource providers
and check against the related compute nodes whether they have
orphaned allocations.

NOTE(artom) In train _wait_for_server_parameter() and
_wait_for_state_change() still take an api param (it was removed in
7ae1a10913). This backport had to pass self.admin_api.

NOTE(artom) The FUP 35ec5a0bd1 is squashed into the backport.

Change-Id: I537ed74503d208957f0a97af3ab754a6750dac20
Closes-Bug: #1793569
(cherry picked from commit c03716be1f3e9fd5a5e9adf95860c7ce4bfe211f)

commit_message:
Fix the argument check for account-generator

Concurrency parameter for account-generator command was accepting
negative values and zero.

This patch makes sure that when the account-generator is passed
a negative value or zero, it ends with an error.

Closes-Bug: #1811349
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage
Change-Id: I4d7de89b2ad3ee91d113da3746fe393d8cce2aa2

subject: Enable DB access for n-api-meta
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-02-07 14:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-07 14:40:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm, I probably need Dan Smith here since the nova-metadata service can be run with nova-api (which has direct DB access) or standalone, and when run standalone it has the conductor indirection API, which means it routes DB requests over RPC and therefore shouldn't *need* direct DB access, so there might be something else missing here."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-07 14:41:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-07 14:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-07 14:45:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-07 14:48:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Without a bug that has details of the failure it's hard to know what you're hitting, but I'm guessing it's something with no DB access to the instance_mappings table (which is in the nova_api database). I think the solution is setting https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/configuration/config.html#api.local_metadata_per_cell to true in the standalone n-api-meta service on the subnode."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-02-07 15:14:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

The patch doesn't work, as I'm getting

[database]
connection =

in nova.conf, which also cause n-api-meta to blow up. The original error is http://paste.openstack.org/show/744683/, I'll create a proper bug tomorrow."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-07 15:26:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

OK I think the issue is that when running nova-metadata under uwsgi, we don't set the conductor indirection API which would otherwise happen if running under eventlet:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3cfcd117ce7ddb5a8d94396191cde559db73fb86/nova/cmd/api_metadata.py#L45

We should likely be doing that here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/3cfcd117ce7ddb5a8d94396191cde559db73fb86/nova/api/metadata/wsgi.py#L19

So this is a nova bug. Jens - I'll open a nova bug and propose a patch which hopefully you can test out in your environment since it appears we don't have any multinode jobs that run with the separate n-api-meta service?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-07 16:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Here is the nova bug:

commit_message:
Enable DB access for n-api-meta

The nova metadata API may run on its own in some scenarios, see e.g.
[0]. It fails without database access.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/devstack/latest/guides/multinode-lab.html

commit_message:
Inject /v3 in token path for v3 plugins

Without this, it's possible to get HTTP 404 errors from keystone if
OS_AUTH_URL isn't versioned (e.g., https://keystone.example.com/ instead
of https://keystone.example.com/v3), even if OS_IDENTITY_API is set to
3.

This commit works around this issue by checking the AUTH_URL before
building the token_url and appending '/v3' to the URL before sending the
request.

Closes-Bug: 1876317

Change-Id: Ic75f0c9b36022b884105b87bfe05f4f8292d53b2
(cherry picked from commit ad46262148e7b099e6c7239887e20ade5b8e6ac8)

commit_message:
New config option 'user_limit' in credentials

This patch allows adds new config option 'user_limit'
to credentials to set maximum number of credentials a
user is permitted to create.
Closes-Bug: #1872732

Change-Id: Ic9dc9a4a9ec1ecbf01842c865e19a7a100e5041d

commit_message:
Networking boot fallback for local boot

Adds an ability to generate network boot templates even for nodes that
use local boot via the new ``[pxe]enable_netboot_fallback`` option.
This is required to work around the situation when switching boot devices
does not work reliably.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/736191/
Change-Id: Id80f2d88f9c92ff102340309a526a9b3992c6038
Story: #2007610
Task: #39600

[{'created': '2020-06-19 20:54:31.000000000', 'message': '[ci] Use dynamic credential provider in DHSS=False tests

Manila's tempest tests create test credentials on
the fly using tempest's dynamic test credential
framework. Launchpad bug 1883795 points to an issue
where we're forcing the creation of test accounts dynamically
even when "[auth]/use_dynamic_credentials" has been set
to False. The appropriate fix [0] for that bug is to
skip tests that *require* a new test credential.
This leads us to lose test coverage in such a situation.
Currently, manila tempest tests cannot be run reliably
with dynamic credentials when testing DHSS=True drivers.
See bugs [1][2][3][4]; So these tests use the
pre-provisioned test credentials framework
as a workaround. We plan to fix this soon [5].

In the meantime, we don't want to lose test coverage
by turning off dynamic credentials all the time.

So ensure we're running with dynamic creds turned on
for all test jobs except the DHSS=True jobs. After
[5] merges, we can turn on dynamic credentials
everywhere.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/736195/
[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1762900
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1604732
[3] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1607069
[4] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1679715
[5] https://review.opendev.org/728604/

Change-Id: I48c41fd197118e5fd701e9e8056802c8c0895410
Related-Bug: #1883795
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[ci] Use dynamic credential provider in DHSS=False tests

Manila's tempest tests create test credentials on
the fly using tempest's dynamic test credential
framework. Launchpad bug 1883795 points to an issue
where we're forcing the creation of test accounts dynamically
even when "[auth]/use_dynamic_credentials" has been set
to False. The appropriate fix [0] for that bug is to
skip tests that *require* a new test credential.
This leads us to lose test coverage in such a situation.
Currently, manila tempest tests cannot be run reliably
with dynamic credentials when testing DHSS=True drivers.
See bugs [1][2][3][4]; So these tests use the
pre-provisioned test credentials framework
as a workaround. We plan to fix this soon [5].

In the meantime, we don't want to lose test coverage
by turning off dynamic credentials all the time.

So ensure we're running with dynamic creds turned on
for all test jobs except the DHSS=True jobs. After
[5] merges, we can turn on dynamic credentials
everywhere.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/736195/
[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1762900
[2] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1604732
[3] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1607069
[4] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1679715
[5] https://review.opendev.org/728604/

Change-Id: I48c41fd197118e5fd701e9e8056802c8c0895410
Related-Bug: #1883795
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[tests] Remove pip and install virtualenv instead

We don't need pip for tests, only virtualenv. We therefore
replace the implementation to install and use virtualenv.

Change-Id: I88fc54769eff51cf07bc4496dc2a9aa538af5bb4

subject: Release python-adjutantclient for victoria-1 milestone
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-15 20:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-15 20:39:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Normally we have bumped the major version with the drop of py27 since that is backwards incompatible. But since this is still a 0.x.0 release today, we have some flexibility with this versioning. If this project is not ready to call a 1.0.0 release with the stability that implies, this can be updated to be a 0.6.0.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-19 10:12:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM waiting for PTL approval (ok for a major release 505504f)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 19:08:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We are several days past the deadline for this release, but will wait a little bit longer since this currently bumps to the 1.0.0 release. It would be good to get confirmation from the team that this is actually ready to be considered a 1.0.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2020-06-23 03:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> We are several days past the deadline for this release, but will
 > wait a little bit longer since this currently bumps to the 1.0.0
 > release. It would be good to get confirmation from the team that

commit_message:
Release python-adjutantclient for victoria-1 milestone

This is a library release for python-adjutantclient for the victoria-1
milestone. This repo includes commits that have not been releases for
this cycle yet.

If the team is ready to process with this release, please leave a +1
to indicate we should go ahead with the release.

If the team needs more time for things about to merge, or if there is
some other reason a release should not be done at this time, please
leave a -1 with a comment indicating the status. Then update the patch
with the new commit hash to use once the team is ready to do the
release.

Change-Id: Ia94ec32e8a3cd782a14c6b7bf839e982f1f40b13
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-06-17 21:28:41.000000000', 'message': 'Disable presettled metrics

Our lab testing shows that message loss is unacceptably high when using
presettled mode for non-trivial metrics volumes. "unsettled" mode (the
alternative) has been shown to be 100% reliable while still acheiving equal or
greater overall max throughput in live testing with a baremetal cloud.

Change-Id: I9388994ee94ab1e3c3e15768a8eb96069c2d8a0b
(cherry picked from commit 15dfacb655d84cc0557962d5c24d385b8bf0974d)

commit_message:
Disable presettled metrics

Our lab testing shows that message loss is unacceptably high when using
presettled mode for non-trivial metrics volumes. "unsettled" mode (the
alternative) has been shown to be 100% reliable while still acheiving equal or
greater overall max throughput in live testing with a baremetal cloud.

Change-Id: I9388994ee94ab1e3c3e15768a8eb96069c2d8a0b
(cherry picked from commit 15dfacb655d84cc0557962d5c24d385b8bf0974d)

[{'created': '2020-06-02 19:01:03.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ie7c18f2f1b6294e3d19c36112d35f4472ce77e7b

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Ife7e5175cebdaa454c61f7f9f768e3dc4221385a

those are not needed for tracking.

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Ide97d869c5e56e56e2a522f198f0973504972697

commit_message:
zuul: use the correct syntax for a jinja test (non filter)

The usage of jinja tests as filters was deprecated in Ansible 2.5
and removed in Ansible 2.9 (now used by zuul).

https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/porting_guides/porting_guide_2.5.html#jinja-tests-used-as-filters

Change-Id: I21684c3f0ae9ee9e67359b504d99679cfaa5ee13

commit_message:
Release greenthread when computing checksum

Having time.sleep(0) after reading each block of data for computing
checksum will allow other greenthreads to run.

Closes-Bug: 1882569
Change-Id: I6e547d206de9e3e333e29ccad52bf6b519a86ff9
(cherry picked from commit b9938230f992935e8332b6e288937be890724cd2)

subject: Fix wsgi SSL tests for wsgi module under python 3
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-16 12:48:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-16 13:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-17 10:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 15:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-06-22 15:30:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-16 12:48:37.000000000', 'message': "Fix wsgi SSL tests for wsgi module under python 3

Previously some tests were ignored under python 3 environment, this was
due to some design changes introduced by python 3.7 [1] in the SSL
module of the stdlib. These changes reactivate some of them (some other
are still skipped and needs further works).

Indeed, when we try to use requests with SSL in a monkey patched
environment we faced the following issue:

```
TypeError: wrap_socket() got an unexpected keyword argument '_context'
```

This is due to the fact that we are in a monkey patched environment
where `requests` is monkey patched too.

We don't need `request` for our needs. Indeed we can easily send
http requests through low level socket. Our main goal is to test
our wsgi server and not to test the `requests` library, and `requests`
was just used to make the code more simpler.

In our case we can implement a code dedicated to send request to our green
server, unlock our tests and move away from this bug/side effect.

Also this reactivated test will check WSGI server with and without SSL,
so these changes add changes that allow us to submit a request without
wrapping the socket with SSL.

These changes move away from `requests` which is badly monkey patched by
eventlet [1]. Now we use monkey patched socket and ssl to
request the green server which is executed in background. Low level
(monkey patched) modules could help us to skirt layers that are possibly
badly monkey patched on higher level modules (urllib, requests, etc...).

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526#issuecomment-482694279
[2] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526

Change-Id: I3a018d507d102266c1e2fc9b6732a9c09fa2bb49
Close-Bug: #1482633
"}, {'created': '2020-06-16 13:11:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix wsgi SSL tests for wsgi module under python 3

Previously some tests were ignored under python 3 environment, this was
due to some design changes introduced by python 3.7 [1] in the SSL
module of the stdlib. These changes reactivate some of them (some other
are still skipped and needs further works).

Indeed, when we try to use requests with SSL in a monkey patched
environment we faced the following issue:

```
TypeError: wrap_socket() got an unexpected keyword argument '_context'
```

This is due to the fact that we are in a monkey patched environment
where `requests` is monkey patched too.

We don't need `request` for our needs. Indeed we can easily send
http requests through low level socket. Our main goal is to test
our wsgi server and not to test the `requests` library, and `requests`
was just used to make the code more simpler.

In our case we can implement a code dedicated to send request to our green
server, unlock our tests and move away from this bug/side effect.

Also this reactivated test will check WSGI server with and without SSL,
so these changes add changes that allow us to submit a request without
wrapping the socket with SSL.

These changes move away from `requests` which is badly monkey patched by
eventlet [1]. Now we use monkey patched socket and ssl to
request the green server which is executed in background. Low level
(monkey patched) modules could help us to skirt layers that are possibly
badly monkey patched on higher level modules (urllib, requests, etc...).

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526#issuecomment-482694279
[2] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526

Change-Id: I3a018d507d102266c1e2fc9b6732a9c09fa2bb49
Close-Bug: #1482633
"}, {'created': '2020-06-17 10:23:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix wsgi SSL tests for wsgi module under python 3

due to some design changes introduced by python 3.7 [1] in the SSL

are still skipped and needs further works).

Indeed, when we try to use requests with SSL in a monkey patched
environment we faced the following issue:

```
TypeError: wrap_socket() got an unexpected keyword argument '_context'
```

This is due to the fact that we are in a monkey patched environment
where `requests` is monkey patched too.

We don't need `request` for our needs. Indeed we can easily send
http requests through low level socket. Our main goal is to test

In our case we can implement a code dedicated to send request to our green
server, unlock our tests and move away from this bug/side effect.

Also this reactivated test will check WSGI server with and without SSL,
so these changes add changes that allow us to submit a request without
wrapping the socket with SSL.

These changes move away from `requests` which is badly monkey patched by
eventlet [1]. Now we use monkey patched socket and ssl to

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526#issuecomment-482694279

commit_message:
Fix wsgi SSL tests for wsgi module under python 3

Previously some tests were ignored under python 3 environment, this was
due to some design changes introduced by python 3.7 [1] in the SSL
module of the stdlib. These changes reactivate some of them (some other
are still skipped and needs further works).

Indeed, when we try to use requests with SSL in a monkey patched
environment we faced the following issue:

```
TypeError: wrap_socket() got an unexpected keyword argument '_context'
```

This is due to the fact that we are in a monkey patched environment
where `requests` is monkey patched too.

We don't need `request` for our needs. Indeed we can easily send
http requests through low level socket. Our main goal is to test
our wsgi server and not to test the `requests` library, and `requests`
was just used to make the code more simpler.

In our case we can implement a code dedicated to send request to our green
server, unlock our tests and move away from this bug/side effect.

Also this reactivated test will check WSGI server with and without SSL,
so these changes add changes that allow us to submit a request without
wrapping the socket with SSL.

These changes move away from `requests` which is badly monkey patched by
eventlet [1]. Now we use monkey patched socket and ssl to
request the green server which is executed in background. Low level
(monkey patched) modules could help us to skirt layers that are possibly
badly monkey patched on higher level modules (urllib, requests, etc...).

[1] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526#issuecomment-482694279
[2] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/526

Change-Id: I3a018d507d102266c1e2fc9b6732a9c09fa2bb49
Closes-Bug: #1482633

[{'created': '2020-06-16 12:34:57.000000000', 'message': 'Reactivate wsgi test related to socket option under python 3

Previously these tests was ignored surely because the WSGI tests
with SSL were broken due to some design changes introduced by python 3.7 [1]
in the SSL module of the stdlib.

However, unlike the other WSGI/SSL tests these changes don't use
the `requests` module or high level modules which are broken by
the monkey patching of the stdlib.

I suppose previous developers simply turned off all of tests related to
WSGI/SSL without much more details than "SSL tests with python 3 and eventlet
is broken" but some of them don't need much more work than just reactivate
them to be ran successfully.

This test seems to work without change, and it run successfully locally.

Let reactivate this test.

Change-Id: Ie0257af10a9439de8ec124a698ca75778bdf90b5
Partial-Bug: #1482633
'}]
commit_message:
Reactivate wsgi test related to socket option under python 3

Previously these tests was ignored surely because the WSGI tests
with SSL were broken due to some design changes introduced by python 3.7 [1]
in the SSL module of the stdlib.

However, unlike the other WSGI/SSL tests these changes don't use
the `requests` module or high level modules which are broken by
the monkey patching of the stdlib.

I suppose previous developers simply turned off all of tests related to
WSGI/SSL without much more details than "SSL tests with python 3 and eventlet
is broken" but some of them don't need much more work than just reactivate
them to be ran successfully.

This test seems to work without change, and it run successfully locally.

Let reactivate this test.

Change-Id: Ie0257af10a9439de8ec124a698ca75778bdf90b5
Partial-Bug: #1482633

commit_message:
Ignore a struture error (E010) on bashate

It could be less annoying to ignore the E010 [1] and allow us to don't fight
against base syntaxe error with "for do" statements by avoiding
semicolon.

Also these changes add some comments about the ignored rules.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/bashate/latest/readme.html#structure-errors

Change-Id: Ic16027bf97eb93d25fbfed21843f9df855571fa9

commit_message:
policy: Migrate Default Policy Format from JSON to YAML

A combination of factors has resulted in problems with deprecating policies.
We need to make some changes in order to allow policy deprecation without
causing pain to OpenStack deployers.

Change-Id: Ic213601b6e9406970fc5b83e53e02213ae236106

commit_message:
Enable bridge debugging services on the tempest and grenade jobs

This patch moves functions to enable br-ex-tcpdump and br-int-flows
services from the ovn devstack plugin to the main neutron devstack
plugin and enables it on all tempest and grenade jobs which are using
neutron-openvswitch-agent as a L2 backend.

Change-Id: Idfea869c08811914124d076da18cec17a12eee49

subject: Remove elementtree deprecated methods
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 09:33:14.000000000', 'message': 'Remove elementtree deprecated methods

All our supported runtimes [1] are compatible with the recommended
alternatives.

`Element.getchildren` [2] is deprecated since python 3.2 and will be removed
in python 3.9, these changes switch usages to `list(elem)`.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.getchildren

Change-Id: I3ef75bcb5550b86c0a6702e186b4d285b64af182
'}]
commit_message:
Remove elementtree deprecated methods

All our supported runtimes [1] are compatible with the recommended
alternatives.

`Element.getchildren` [2] is deprecated since python 3.2 and will be removed
in python 3.9, these changes switch usages to `list(elem)`.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.getchildren

Change-Id: I3ef75bcb5550b86c0a6702e186b4d285b64af182

commit_message:
monasca-agent: Add pwdutils and shadow-utils for useradd/groupadd

openstack-monasca-agent is currently failing to build due to missing
useradd/groupadd binaries this change adds pwdutils and shadow-utils
dependencies.

Change-Id: I0a938e1d411c9e84f2551478e53e7c47655aae60

commit_message:
Support multi-tenants in selective topology distribution

Now, the selective topology distribution doesn't support multi-tenants
scenarios. This spec proposes a solution based on RBAC for it.

Change-Id: I562b5e765fddf656f9aa9c8cd2ae95425861041f
TODO: add bp link

@Itamar,

I think a relatively elegant way to solve this would require 2 things:

* Expose our chassis entries as agents to Neutron
* Expose ports on non-Dragonflow nodes with a port binding that Dragonflow will understand.

This way both Dragonflow/non-Dragonflow won't have to support 'interop-mode', but rather will see the topology as if it was on the same type."}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2017-09-03 08:32:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 18347, 'date': '2017-09-04 11:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Dima
Yes I agree, and this actually makes even a better sense, as we will be able to support l2 population, natively, and be interoperable by design. I consider renaming this rst to l2 population support :)'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2017-09-05 02:08:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add debug information when DHCP app gets tags

The value error about user tags should be logged with LOG.exception,
no matter it's catched or not. And the exception infomation should
be logged to users.

Change-Id: Ib9ca02f9feb09dd919602b85134432667d082add

commit_message:
Add config option: Disable BUM flows

As a workaround to bug #1700473 , where an exception happens when there
are more than ~1000 ports on a network, allow to disable the BUM flow
which causes the error.

Change-Id: Id54cb3b0e0195fdaa310e95c06a3da37da0d3b8c
Related-Bug: #1700473

commit_message:
Support qos in network

qos in port has been supported in [1]. Neutron api also supports qos
in network. The qos of network will be the default qos for the port
in network, if the port doesn't have an explicit qos.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/qos-app

Implements: blueprint qos-app
Change-Id: I76e3b93d55aea70a764cefb23707cf320ad17606

Sorry for the late comment, I think we can do something better.

We can implement a dummy DB driver, that stores objects in memory, and use the regular NB API object, with the dummy driver. This will save us mimicking a lot of NB API functionality.

The dummy DB driver can be implemented by plain dictionaries or maybe even DbStore.'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2017-07-13 11:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

'}, {'created': '2017-07-06 05:15:01.000000000', 'message': 'Improve with_nb_objects

Two main imporvements are added:
1. with_nb_objects can now be used in a with context (via the context
   method)

2. Added a _get method, so that nb_api.get also returns the objects,

commit_message:
Improve with_nb_objects

Two main imporvements are added:
1. with_nb_objects can now be used in a with context (via the context
   method)

2. Added a _get method, so that nb_api.get also returns the objects,
   if they were passed to the constructor.

Change-Id: I647479dc35c8caf7773f99a9bb6a069ffe6ada41

commit_message:
Always include the external networks in the topology

Each host that will register to the topics of all locally-available
external networks.
At this moment we only subscribe to topics of locally bound lports. With
virtual ports, we're never binding them to any host (some are
even omni-present). This patch proposes a way to keep virtual ports in
external networks available

Related-Bug: #1636829
Change-Id: I08b98d9c57414be9fcfa59d9862406cb5591b1d7

commit_message:
Prevent unnecessary floatingip disassociate during update extra attribute

If we update extra attribute like description, the floatingip related
flows will be removed and added, which will cause traffic connection lost

This patch will make update_floatingip check if we need to send this event
to local controller.

Change-Id: Ib7c679dd593acd4e72eabd0615c04e268096136c

[{'created': '2017-04-07 11:32:54.000000000', 'message': 'do some optimization for l2 app

1. do some simple refactor;
2. remove the remove_logical_lswitch method, because when the last local
port of the lswitch offline, it will remove the corresponding multicast
flow automatically.

Change-Id: Ic1a569aece0eec3e5bac7f861b95ee4e88c8d12a
'}]
commit_message:
do some optimization for l2 app

1. do some simple refactor;
2. remove the remove_logical_lswitch method, because when the last local
port of the lswitch offline, it will remove the corresponding multicast
flow automatically.

Change-Id: Ic1a569aece0eec3e5bac7f861b95ee4e88c8d12a

tl;dr Please move the added code to a library file.

This change adds a lot of code that was removed in a different patch. It was removed mostly since it's library code that should not sit in the SG App module.

Would it be possible to move this code to a library file? It would help organising the code, the tests, and we may be able to move it outside of Dragonflow to e.g. oslo.

Once this is in a library module, it will also be easier to test the performance differences, since we can test the library implementation directly, and not the entire SG app."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-04-04 02:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-15 08:23:26.000000000', 'message': 'Save the aggregated addresses by IPNetwork list instead of IPSet

Currently, those aggregated addresses are saved by IPSet, causes
all addresses need be took into count when computing the CIDRs
if any address is added to or removed from those addresses.
In large scale, that will cause performance problem as described
in the bug comments.
This patch will change to use a list of IPNetwork/CIDR to save those
addresses, so only related CIDRs will be renew computed when changes
happened.

Closes-Bug: 1642895
Change-Id: Iab1f9c74cadc8ffd2db6bcf2286780f2317678f7

commit_message:
Save the aggregated addresses by IPNetwork list instead of IPSet

Currently, those aggregated addresses are saved by IPSet, causes
all addresses need be took into count when computing the CIDRs
if any address is added to or removed from those addresses.
In large scale, that will cause performance problem as described
in the bug comments.
This patch will change to use a new class named CIDRList to save those
addresses, so only related CIDRs will be renew computed when changes
happened.
CIDRList class provides those methods:
1) get_cidr_list
2) add_addresses_and_get_changes
3) remove_addresses_and_get_changes
4) update_addresses_and_get_changes

Closes-Bug: 1642895
Change-Id: Iab1f9c74cadc8ffd2db6bcf2286780f2317678f7

commit_message:
Add structure to unit test

As the project grows, the number unit test cases grows. This patch
proposes a check to match unit test module to a project module.
So that we can have a better management of project files.

Change-Id: I4827ff3d10d4ddbe94761acb80fdc014fa069096
Partial-Bug: #1679993
