commit_message:
Dragonflow interoperablity with neutron openvswitch agent

Neutron inter-operability support enables Compute nodes with dragonflow
local controller share overlay connectivity with compute nodes using
neutron reference implementation.

Change-Id: I6f9a2968ffaae366c0f0a30556085c4f50587cbf
Partially-implements: bp neutron-interop

(12 comments)

I would like to raise the question of the correct location for the code added to the l2 app.

On the one hand, the l2 app should only handle basic switching.

On the other hand, the active port detection re-uses a lot of its code, and it does boil down to updating the flows to match the correct mac to the correct reg7 port.

I'd like to hear other reviewers' opinions. If this won't be settled by next week, we'll take this up in the weekly meeting."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-02-23 04:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

commit_message:
add L2 app process when active port events happened

There is already a APP to detect the active port
which actually use the address of allowed address pairs,
but L2/L3 apps don't yet add the corresponding process
about the detected active port.
This patch will add L2 app process about active port.

Change-Id: Idc0ab46d569051c41c4bbd31bc001125eb2fd161
Partially-Implements: blueprint allowed-address-pairs

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11159, 'date': '2016-09-09 03:28:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't know if there is such requirement or if there is not such requirement.

I am curious what problem does this patch resolve? or what benefit does it bring to dragonflow?

I am down-voting because I have this concern. The 'chassis' of lport will use the 'bing:host_id' from neutron, which is most likely to be the hostname/ip of the host. If we add customized chassis name, it might cause problem to bind port in dragonflow. I haven't tested it, but I take a glance at the code and find [1]. So, again, I want to ask the above 2 questions :)

[1] https://github.com/openstack/dragonflow/blob/00b49a8a11b622ca15ce48fb956a09720de508f8/dragonflow/controller/df_local_controller.py#L235"}, {'account_id': 18903, 'date': '2016-09-12 11:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Hong Hui Xiao
Thank you for comments. I see now that this code is still not ready.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-01 16:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2016-12-11 13:14:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

What's the status of this patch? Is it still in progress? @Yuli, do you want to push this feature forwards?

@xiaohhui I think this feature may be useful if the chassis name is different from the host name. This came up in tests where we ran many df-local-controllers, and needed ways to differentiate them. The binding profile (and location) is decided in northbound, so if we want to create 'fake' ports, technically we could.

As I said, I am not sure how desired this feature is."}, {'account_id': 9044, 'date': '2017-02-14 07:20:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@xiao hong hui, for you concern about 'bing:host_id', I think the config option 'host' from neutron.conf can solve it, because all neutron components, e.g neutron-server, l2-agent use this option. So I prefer to use the 'host' option, just like this patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/433364/"}, {'account_id': 9044, 'date': '2017-02-14 07:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Some more information, it says all agents and service *must* use the same value
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/conf/common.py#L101'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 04:07:36.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-23 17:20:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

- gate-dragonflow-dsvm-fullstack-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/23/431423/1/check/gate-dragonflow-dsvm-fullstack-ubuntu-xenial/79bb7ab/ : SUCCESS in 1h 29m 03s'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2017-02-12 08:24:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

There are some things that bother me in this design:

1. Why tack the information on the binding profile? I'd prefer a completely external method of assigining IPs to tenants: e,g, a predefined network/subnet (provided in config), where whenever a chassis has a new tenant added (alt. removed) to it, a port from that network is allocated (alt. deallocated). The (df controller side) application knows to detect these flows and update them.

2. I'd rather have application specific (e.g. not networking core stuff) outside the main mech_driver. The main thought is that pure pluggability means that anything that is not core stuff (e.g. l2) can be placed in an external module. This means the applications, neutron-server-side code, etc., can be seamlessly moved out of tree. Having everything in separate files facilitates this (I know this breaks when it comes to table-numbering. We're working on it (: )"}, {'account_id': 24229, 'date': '2017-02-12 13:01:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24229, 'date': '2017-02-12 13:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

Answered comments to patch set #1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-02-12 14:34:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
SNAT application - tenant sNAT strategy and mech driver support

Patch combines tenant sNAT strategy and required mech driver support
DF application based on implemented sNAT infra

Tenant sNAT mode has extra mech_driver parameter to allocate provider IPs
 - enable_addr_alloc_for_snat

Based on br-ex <-> br-int connector that curently defined by dnat app
and will be further moved to provider_networks app

UpgradeImpact: OVS version>=2.6
Partially-Implements: blueprint snat-distribution
Change-Id: I41a48745163f963b1ab7bbe95091e44c18443818

'}, {'created': '2017-12-21 20:23:45.000000000', 'message': 'Rewrite Trunk App

The current implementation of the Trunk application assumed that each
segmentation type adds exactly one flow. This is not the case for
MACVLAN and IPVLAN, which add flows for both IPv4/IPv6, and ARP in case
of IPv4.

This change enables the Trunk app to be extended such that each
segmentation_type can have as many flows as it needs.

Change-Id: I7ca3a39bc5bb8d3e3c8d82fb98e814e950e34d7c
Closes-Bug: #1720734
'}, {'created': '2017-12-21 20:29:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add MACVLAN fullstack tests

commit_message:
[WIP] Add spec for importing configuration from Neutron

This feature is required to add DragonFlow to an environment that is
already installed and running

Change-Id: Iaafc1c24be0d5b653ba9f2588a71203d34bf6d58
Related-Bug: #1742621

commit_message:
[WIP] POC -  drivers for kuryr to access df-api directly

This is POC for running df as k8s networking infratrcute by writing
drivers for kuryr. (this code isn't tested yet so probebly it's
not working ..)

Change-Id: Ib172acbcbf7bb68daf73f963d74b0406e2312e64

commit_message:
Add upgrade script for Make Subnet a first-order model

The patch Make Subnet a first-order model removes subnets from
LogicalNetworks, and adds a backref. This patch migrates the database.

Change-Id: Id84c348800837bc1414cfd22ec84a64ebfb39600
Depends-On: I369f7d99626f07b8e22a13bf374dae06697468bc

commit_message:
Added migration code to remove peer_bridge from OvsPort

As we removed the 'peer_bridge' field from the OvsPort object. Add
migration code for next versions.

While this code *should* be a no-op, since the object isn't stored in
the database, it is provided here for completion.

Change-Id: Iffcc8be3d656eedfe75de324c125825b2b7449ff
Related-bug: #1722839

[{'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2017-12-13 15:30:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-12-14 05:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26131, 'date': '2017-12-14 06:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

In second though- 

The DHCP ports that create in Newton are "one port per subnet". as we change that in queens to "one port per lswitch" , we need to delete all dhcp per subnet port, and create new ports per switch. 
Currently this issue is real problem as this raise the need to update neutron DB with the changes - and neutron server is down. 
(I added suggestion for fixing it in the migration spec patch )'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2017-12-27 11:26:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2017-12-28 07:15:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2017-12-28 10:06:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add upgrade code for DHCP port per network

DHCP port per network patch effectively removed the dhcp_ip and
enabled_dhcp fields from the Subnet object. This patch provides the
relevant upgrade code.

Change-Id: I098152e8083af17b8a07ea44893d689e4804544f
Closes-Bug: #1737981

messages:
[{'account_id': 11159, 'date': '2016-11-23 11:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23766, 'date': '2016-11-23 11:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Are there any concurrency issues?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-23 11:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-dragonflow-docs-ubuntu-xenial http://docs-draft.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-dragonflow-docs-ubuntu-xenial/3627ac7//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 51s
- gate-dragonflow-pep8-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-dragonflow-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/425a8de/ : SUCCESS in 2m 59s
- gate-dragonflow-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-dragonflow-python27-ubuntu-xenial/c7d777e/ : SUCCESS in 4m 42s
- gate-dragonflow-python35-nv http://logs.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-dragonflow-python35-nv/b1e3dce/ : SUCCESS in 4m 31s (non-voting)
- gate-dragonflow-python34 http://logs.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-dragonflow-python34/9c3b208/ : SUCCESS in 3m 11s (non-voting)
- gate-tempest-dsvm-dragonflow http://logs.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-dragonflow/182d41f/ : FAILURE in 17m 00s (non-voting)
- gate-dragonflow-dsvm-rally-nv http://logs.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-dragonflow-dsvm-rally-nv/3c1e819/ : FAILURE in 23m 04s (non-voting)
- gate-dragonflow-dsvm-fullstack-nv http://logs.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-dragonflow-dsvm-fullstack-nv/268ba91/ : FAILURE in 19m 38s (non-voting)
- gate-dragonflow-dsvm-fullstack-ml2-nv http://logs.openstack.org/10/401210/1/check/gate-dragonflow-dsvm-fullstack-ml2-nv/37bcd10/ : FAILURE in 25m 31s (non-voting)'}, {'account_id': 11159, 'date': '2016-11-23 12:02:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Are there any concurrency issues?

Good question! The allocate_unique_key is concurrent safe. But there is still some change that node A allocate unique key for lswitch1, before it writes back to nb db, another node B allocate unique key for the same lswitch.

This will cause the unique_key in different nodes are different. And the former unique_key is wasted. I think we can bear that, as unique_key for lswitch don't require to be global unique(only unique in one node), and the issue that is trying to resolve here is not too often.

To make it perfect, I will have to do much more code change to make the operation atomic. I don't have a good idea for the perfect solution yet. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 20287, 'date': '2016-11-23 12:22:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Is it necessary to do the ensure_xxx_exist() judgement whenever some object has a new field, such as unique_key, version or something else in the future? As the code may change in few days or weeks in current stage:)'}, {'account_id': 11159, 'date': '2016-11-23 23:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Is it necessary to do the ensure_xxx_exist() judgement whenever
 > some object has a new field, such as unique_key, version or
 > something else in the future? As the code may change in few days or
 > weeks in current stage:)

That should be a problem if we update the nb db schema, frequently.  We might need to provide some migration script for that if the change.

I would fix the issue this way for now, as this is the only case and unique_key is something special. We can provide a default value to most of new value(version or other fields), but we can't provide default value to unique_key. What do you think?

I know it is not a perfect solution. But until better solution has been proposed, I can only use this to fix the issue."}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2016-11-24 21:34:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The problem hujie faces is also present here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402092/ . We need to make a decision on how to continue: Do we support backwards compatibility (say 1 cycle?) or each patch that changes the data model also has to provide a migration script?

Please share your thoughts.'}, {'account_id': 11159, 'date': '2016-11-24 23:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

> The problem hujie faces is also present here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/402092/
 > . We need to make a decision on how to continue: Do we support
 > backwards compatibility (say 1 cycle?) or each patch that changes
 > the data model also has to provide a migration script?
 > 
 > Please share your thoughts.

If there are any other cases that might need to re-shape the nb db. Then I think migration script is good.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-25 01:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 23766, 'date': '2016-11-27 07:38:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Hong Hui Xiao
 > > Are there any concurrency issues?
 > 
 > Good question! The allocate_unique_key is concurrent safe. But
 > there is still some change that node A allocate unique key for
 > lswitch1, before it writes back to nb db, another node B allocate
 > unique key for the same lswitch.
 > 
 > This will cause the unique_key in different nodes are different.
 > And the former unique_key is wasted. I think we can bear that, as
 > unique_key for lswitch don't require to be global unique(only
 > unique in one node), and the issue that is trying to resolve here
 > is not too often.
 > 
 > To make it perfect, I will have to do much more code change to make
 > the operation atomic. I don't have a good idea for the perfect
 > solution yet. What do you think?

I was thinking of a similar scenario where 2 services allocate ID for the same resource. What about duplicated flows when the service that has the wrong ID is brought down and the back up (and reads the correct ID)."}, {'account_id': 11159, 'date': '2016-11-29 07:07:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7805, 'date': '2016-11-29 07:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If the schema changes, I think it is good to provide a migration script for that change. It is enough.'}, {'account_id': 11159, 'date': '2016-11-29 08:20:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> If the schema changes, I think it is good to provide a migration
 > script for that change. It is enough.

I am OK with either way, I just think a script for a change might not be good for code management, and if change B is based on change A, that will make the script more complex. So I wrap the script(which is 	dragonflow/db/migration/lswitch_unique_key.py in this case) into the df-db command.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-29 08:33:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-23 11:30:50.000000000', 'message': 'Allocate unique_key for lswitch if not exist

unique_key is a new field for lswitch since [1], for the data that
exists before [1]. It will not have unique_key, and will break the
usecase of unique_key for lswitch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/394017/

Change-Id: Ibe1f04c4e8c09a706b4160a2fd729deafb408752
Closes-Bug: #1644111
'}, {'created': '2016-11-29 07:07:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add nb db migration mechanism and apply to lswitch unique_key

This patch adds the nb db migration mechanism by providing a new
command *df-db upgrade*

unique_key is a new field for lswitch since [1], for the data that
exists before [1]. It will not have unique_key, and will break the
usecase of unique_key for lswitch.

This patch also applies the db migration to unique_key of lswitch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/394017/

Change-Id: Ibe1f04c4e8c09a706b4160a2fd729deafb408752
Closes-Bug: #1644111

the usecase of unique_key for lswitch.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/394017/

commit_message:
Add north-bound DB migration mechanism

This change introduces DB migration framework. The initial mechanism
creates a snapshot of the database in-memory, runs all new migration
scripts. If all scripts succeed without error, database is committed.

Change-Id: Ibe1f04c4e8c09a706b4160a2fd729deafb408752
Co-Authored-By: Dima Kuznetsov <dima.kuznetsov@toganetworks.com>
Closes-Bug: #1644111

commit_message:
Module tripleo_list_overclouds

When upgrading the undercloud it will be necessary to have some
ansible tasks to loop on tasks which operate on every existing stack.

This simple module will lookup existing heat stacks and return a list
of stacks which appear to be overcloud stacks. They are assumed to be
overcloud stacks if they have the output: AnsibleHostVarsMap.

Change-Id: Ib7dc2c968a5aaff40696f591caa2399c0fb5a7bc
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Draft PAT support.

PAT is similar to DNAT, except instead of mapping a public IP address to a
private IP, PAT maps a port on a public IP address to a port on a private IP.

Change-Id: I53852644f425b5ded040abfd392f7cac861c3f5e
Signed-off-by: Pino de Candia <giuseppe.decandia@gmail.com>

commit_message:
L2: Drop BUM packets the port sends to itself

Add flows to detect broadcast (and multicast) packets sent by a virtual
port that will retransmit to itself.

Change-Id: Ic3afab9378cf84953bca2e7e576ed6f39dd321bb

locked_objects_db: Take function to get lock-id

Rather than infer from type.

commit_message:
[WIP] [DNR] Add subscriber mechanism to the skydive app

This is in order to get the notificaitons about added/deleted/modified
objects.

TODO:
[ ] Fix owner object (namely gateway port and router)
[ ] Re-enable pubsub on the nb_api creation
[ ] Handle object update
[ ] Handle controller reinitialize
[ ] Handle DB reconnect
[ ] disable pubsub in case it is etcd as it requires monkey_patch

Change-Id: If186a04594df45eb49a2660d1d74cafe8be4cfe7

subject: DNM: test gate use of git src for required-projects
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-08 15:21:50.000000000', 'message': "DNM: test gate use of git src for required-projects

DO NOT MERGE

One of the things we discussed at the PTG in the neutron-lib section [1]
is that neutron-lib-current consumers [2] should be using git source
for their required-projects in the gate rather than using those projects
from PyPI. This includes python based jobs (pep8, py3, etc.) as well
as functional devstack based jobs.

This patch tests if neutron is being pulled from git master source or
from PyPI by trying to access a module that's recently deleted from
neutron.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/openstack-networking-train-ptg
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=neutron-lib-current

Change-Id: I3809fa1553ba50b4e2593f4fc5df7ddb917db5ca

commit_message:
DNM: test gate use of git src for required-projects

DO NOT MERGE

One of the things we discussed at the PTG in the neutron-lib section [1]
is that neutron-lib-current consumers [2] should be using git source
for their required-projects in the gate rather than using those projects
from PyPI. This includes python based jobs (pep8, py3, etc.) as well
as functional devstack based jobs.

This patch tests if neutron is being pulled from git master source or
from PyPI by trying to access a module that's recently deleted from
neutron.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/openstack-networking-train-ptg
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=neutron-lib-current

Change-Id: I3809fa1553ba50b4e2593f4fc5df7ddb917db5ca

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements
- version
- release.

Change-Id: I40e48fe8fcd7247e5a5cf716ef00eae99e5558af

[{'created': '2019-08-19 16:56:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unit-test object version issue

commit_message:
Fix unit-test object version issue

There is an issue in the test_create_delete_policy_rule test.
For some reason the old Neutron-managed object version is sent to
the qos plugin.
This fix circumvents it.

Change-Id: I59d9bba91549dba239fd784634a76538b1d87fe9

use payloads for TRUNK callbacks

This patch switches the code over to the payload style of callbacks [1]
for TRUNK events.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/635060/

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html

Change-Id: Iead771d43f41709b0f20d39cac3154e7192df8eb

commit_message:
Fix the df-model for better openapi support

The way we specified reference fields was not conforming with the standard.
Modified to be only the id, and added a x-referenced-type attribute
to specify the object type we are referencing.

Change-Id: Ibb9779d4e671aa5e7292abc5c5d6d24c895d66ac

unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:12:09.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ia86f271125a9875577dd5015af89115e1aaa545a
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ia86f271125a9875577dd5015af89115e1aaa545a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 18:28:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix empty 'args' and 'kwargs' when using 'hide_args' with Jaeger

When 'hide_args=True' is used in @profiler.trace() decorator
along with Jaeger driver, trace 'args' and 'kwargs' function
parameters are empty, which leads to a key error.

This change introduces a key check before adding those parameters to
tags.

Change-Id: I312da1b175a04d4ddee7f823111b8320dd4777d6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix empty 'args' and 'kwargs' when using 'hide_args' with Jaeger

When 'hide_args=True' is used in @profiler.trace() decorator
along with Jaeger driver, trace 'args' and 'kwargs' function
parameters are empty, which leads to a key error.

This change introduces a key check before adding those parameters to
tags.

Change-Id: I312da1b175a04d4ddee7f823111b8320dd4777d6

commit_message:
Stop translation stable branches on projects without Dashboard

The translation team is focussing on translation of UI/horizon dashboard
projects, so let's only enable translation of stable branches on
these projects.

The list of UI/dashboard projects has been checked with
https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/src/branch/master/tools/list-horizon-plugins.py

It thus makes the following projects have stable branches translated:
networking-bgpvpn
cloudkitty-dashboard

It marks other repos as only translating on master, since mainly release
notes translation happens there (releasenotes are only translated on
master).

Start of discussion:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2020-April/003496.html

Change-Id: Iaf2cf59b8cf65ea4c15129bee2797898bad446fd

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove now unused files babel.cfg and openstack-common.conf.
- Remove use of six library.
- Update to hacking 3.1.0
- Update pbr requirement

Change-Id: Ib4b9460f24cfaa216f0302b3b90ef73d808eb3e4

commit_message:
assert_private() params and deps classes

These classes are private and should never be
used outside of it's module.

Change-Id: I1adc4905ce0f70da6b285eaa0862ca8f206613f6

This script creates a virtualenv to run a requirements script to update
constraints. virtualenv is not globally available anymore. Rather than
trying to call it directly, this now uses tox to set up the virtual
environment.

Change-Id: If00afb50c37b45aefbb45070da4efef3e43e62b2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix venv use in requirements propose_update.sh

This script creates a virtualenv to run a requirements script to update
constraints. virtualenv is not globally available anymore. Rather than
trying to call it directly, this now uses tox to set up the virtual
environment.

Change-Id: If00afb50c37b45aefbb45070da4efef3e43e62b2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Support volume-backed server rebuild in compute

This patch adds support to use a new image to rebuild
the volume backed server. It depends on new
python-cinderclient and cinder API changes to support
re-imaging the root volume. The compute service version
is incremented to indicate the behavior change so the
API can determine if volume-backed rebuild is possible
for a given server.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/622614/

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I6f59d7d040a3b1e84622b51735d5dada7f84c0fe
Implements: blueprint volume-backed-server-rebuild

[{'created': '2020-06-22 20:37:51.000000000', 'message': "Add ensure-tox in functional job

networking-ovn functional jobs run tests using the tox env.
Even tempest jobs need tox to be present to run the tempest
tests in venv. But functional job derived from devstack-minimal
jobs does not make sure tox is present or not. devstack jobs does not
mak sure that as those are not only used for tox run but also for
other integration testing.

Current networking-ovn functional job failure-
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/c374add3ea02455b8464642e3a2f49c6

let's call ensure-tox role in job to make sure tox is present.

Related-Bug: 1884256
Change-Id: I69bb705a33e6d25035987e3f777fd793810208a4
(cherry picked from commit 86e90bfce2169194524cabf4fe6eff5e232c7b91)
(cherry picked manually from
   Neutron commit 8e2cf239c8c1409a3d9a25452930f766894e3657)
"}]
commit_message:
Add ensure-tox in functional job

networking-ovn functional jobs run tests using the tox env.
Even tempest jobs need tox to be present to run the tempest
tests in venv. But functional job derived from devstack-minimal
jobs does not make sure tox is present or not. devstack jobs does not
mak sure that as those are not only used for tox run but also for
other integration testing.

Current networking-ovn functional job failure-
https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/c374add3ea02455b8464642e3a2f49c6

let's call ensure-tox role in job to make sure tox is present.

Related-Bug: 1884256
Change-Id: I69bb705a33e6d25035987e3f777fd793810208a4
(cherry picked from commit 86e90bfce2169194524cabf4fe6eff5e232c7b91)
(cherry picked manually from
   Neutron commit 8e2cf239c8c1409a3d9a25452930f766894e3657)

test_overcloud_deploy: mock getpwuid and os.stat

To avoid touching the filesystem, we should mock these 2 modules.

Change-Id: I9152eec9c78bda3118c8dd7e0c2d1503887ea3ec
Closes-Bug: #1884793

commit_message:
feat(tls): enable tls for keystone and horizon

This patch set enables TLS integration for keystone and horizon in the
horizon job. This also switch to use an intermediate CA as that should
be the normal use case for deployers.

Co-authored-by: Gage Hugo <gagehugo@gmail.com>

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/733289

Change-Id: I8571ded9e3b8dedd985a626bdf5ab34292327772
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

subject: feat(tls): update HTK to support TLS

[{'created': '2020-06-03 17:43:33.000000000', 'message': 'feat(tls): update bootstrap job

Allow options in the bootstrap job to load the proper TLS secret into
the proper envvar so the openstack client can connect properly to
perform the bootstrap.

Change-Id: I9f91e3f53549370711414038a474be9423d5400e
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-06-03 23:14:33.000000000', 'message': 'feat(tls): update htk to support TLS

This patch set:

1. allows options in the bootstrap job to load the
proper TLS secret into the proper envvar so the openstack client can
connect properly to perform the bootstrap.

2. adds in the certificate to make rally work properly with TLS
endpoints.

Change-Id: I9f91e3f53549370711414038a474be9423d5400e
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-06-03 23:38:53.000000000', 'message': 'feat(tls): update htk to support TLS

'}, {'created': '2020-06-04 11:32:39.000000000', 'message': 'feat(tls): update helm-toolkit to support TLS

This patch set:

- allows options in the bootstrap job to load the proper TLS secret into
the  proper envvar so the openstack client can connect properly to
perform bootstrap;

- adds in certificates to make rally work properly with TLS endpoints;

- adds methods to handle TLS secret volume and volumeMount.

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Id2fc1ec8a64ced50edb1a38fad3733cbd93c4d15

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 12:24:25.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce verbosity level when debug is true

Keystone is experiencing memecached timeouts during tempest tests in
CI, and the memcached log is in excess of 20Mbytes. There will be a lot
of write pressure on this log during tempest tests and this patch reduces
the debug log level in an attempt to increase test reliability.

Change-Id: I7db0eb361fc6f09ce64690be2018bf8ed8204e0c
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce verbosity level when debug is true

Keystone is experiencing memecached timeouts during tempest tests in
CI, and the memcached log is in excess of 20Mbytes. There will be a lot
of write pressure on this log during tempest tests and this patch reduces
the debug log level in an attempt to increase test reliability.

Change-Id: I7db0eb361fc6f09ce64690be2018bf8ed8204e0c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 21:29:19.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Create image import factory with admin context

I have no idea if this is right or legit. It seems to me that the API intends
for users to be able to call copy-to-store on images that they are able to
*see*, yet the task itself implicitly disallows this on images they do not
*own*. The justification for this would be that they could just as easily
download and re-upload the image in order to be able to copy it. Assuming that
is the correct intent of the API, I don't know if this is the best way to go
about it or not, but this can serve as a placeholder for it to hopefully let
me proceed with my nova-side test.

Change-Id: Ie141779d9df63dce9a4107f045506a3a43d95944
Related-Bug: #1884587
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Create image import factory with admin context

I have no idea if this is right or legit. It seems to me that the API intends
for users to be able to call copy-to-store on images that they are able to
*see*, yet the task itself implicitly disallows this on images they do not
*own*. The justification for this would be that they could just as easily
download and re-upload the image in order to be able to copy it. Assuming that
is the correct intent of the API, I don't know if this is the best way to go
about it or not, but this can serve as a placeholder for it to hopefully let
me proceed with my nova-side test.

Change-Id: Ie141779d9df63dce9a4107f045506a3a43d95944
Related-Bug: #1884587

commit_message:
[TRAIN ONLY] Ensure interim db migration containers work properly

During the upgrade from Queens to Train we currently fail on non-bootstrap
controllers due to a script failure.

This patch does the following:

1. Implements a better bootstrap node check to ensure that the containers
   only start on the bootstrap nodes.
2. Improves the db migration check to ensure idempotence if the interim
   container is re-run for whatever reason.

Change-Id: I3b610ad2a91ca5deee301c338e4239c25166f41e

commit_message:
Inform that single +2 is required to merge patches

This was agreed with active devs of the project and raised on the
mailing list [1]. From now on, we can merge patches with only a single
+2 vote in Gerrit.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-June/015440.html

Change-Id: I0b631401cdb9a293a4eaeda6c7d9e0d41cb01cee

I see that you allow passing in the ext_id_key, so you've clearly thought about it. :D My gut feeling would be "well, external-ids are there to be used for this kind of thing, so it seems like what anyone would do" but I haven't looked hard enough to really know. If it is neutron-specific, we'd put it in the neutron tree. Otherwise, I'm quite happy for it to live here.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-05-18 07:47:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

 > neutron-specific, we'd put it in the neutron tree. Otherwise, I'm
 > quite happy for it to live here.

You are right, we need to make this as generic as possible. That means we should not:
- implement a specific logic only used in Neutron (although I was also passing the key name, instead of hardcoding it)
- call those new classes with the Neutron logic (floating IP in this case)

My idea:

1) I've seen that QoSDelCommand is used only in ovsdbapp, that means we can "freely" change the signature and improve the functionality. My idea is to, instead of creating a new command, improve QoSDelCommand.

2) About the API, because "qos_del" is already defined and we can't know where is used, we can implement a new method, more generic. Something like "qos_del_ext_id"

What do you think?

commit_message:
Add QoSDelExtIdCommand

This command removes all QoS rules matching a set of keys and
expected values passed in the command instantiation. No exception
is thrown if no QoS is found with the required external IDs.

For example, this will be used in Neutron to delete all QoS
registers related to a floating IP, searching for
neutron.common.ovn.constants.OVN_FIP_EXT_ID_KEY key and
the floating IP register UUID.

Change-Id: I0eb7151eabaf40232f79797b2775c9bb7891013f
Related-Bug: #1877408

'}, {'created': '2020-04-27 10:16:01.000000000', 'message': "delete mirror traffic vlan tag

http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovs-vswitchd.conf.db.5.txt
The VLAN configuration in this column affects Open vSwitch only when it
is doing ''normal switching.'' It does not affect flows set  up  by
an OpenFlow controller, outside of the OpenFlow ''normal action.''

so output action does not strip vlan header, this vlan is local to br-int
tap service vm receives mirrored packet with this vlan, useless.

Closes-Bug: #1870083
Change-Id: I7340e0101feb497441445b6e1b6edc41f81f17fc

commit_message:
delete mirror traffic vlan tag

http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovs-vswitchd.conf.db.5.txt
The VLAN configuration in this column affects Open vSwitch only when it
is doing ''normal switching.'' It does not affect flows set  up  by
an OpenFlow controller, outside of the OpenFlow ''normal action.''

so output action does not strip vlan header, this vlan is local to br-int
tap service vm receives mirrored packet with this vlan, useless.

Closes-Bug: #1870083
Change-Id: I7340e0101feb497441445b6e1b6edc41f81f17fc

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I0b77453c1b8436a5057d1cd33d7f3d5a28f7c394

Leaving this with the capital Z limits access to this file
to the other novajoin container. This can cause the other
container to malfunction. At the very best, the other
container will restart, relabeling the file with it's
settings, which has the proper value of lower z.

Change-Id: Iebcfb9509c58619f9d68d3036775f07683a0fa42
"}]
commit_message:
Change the :Z mount flag to :z

Leaving this with the capital Z limits access to this file
to the other novajoin container. This can cause the other
container to malfunction. At the very best, the other
container will restart, relabeling the file with it's
settings, which has the proper value of lower z.

Change-Id: Iebcfb9509c58619f9d68d3036775f07683a0fa42

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-19 22:39:55.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix svm scoped account

When the NetApp backend starts, it needs to know whether the
`revert_to_snapshot` support exist. So, it was retrieving the
licenses and checking if the `SnapRestore` is included. Using a
scoped account, the backend cannot retrieve that information,
though. So, this patch solves it by sending a fake operation
`revert_to_snapshot` that must fail. Analyzing the given error, it
sets the backend support field.

Closes-Bug: #1882590
Change-Id: Ib71a6cec939288498e48736f129fbfdacaabe9da
(cherry picked from commit 6f58af1ae39b4151db5feaa72deecafb9365ca16)
(cherry picked from commit b5e541a6284200d28c7e6298ec46cb1f2f1eb9b9)
(cherry picked from commit b252cb801d547c9a9717d705303c3206a079c27f)
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix svm scoped account

When the NetApp backend starts, it needs to know whether the
`revert_to_snapshot` support exist. So, it was retrieving the
licenses and checking if the `SnapRestore` is included. Using a
scoped account, the backend cannot retrieve that information,
though. So, this patch solves it by sending a fake operation
`revert_to_snapshot` that must fail. Analyzing the given error, it
sets the backend support field.

Closes-Bug: #1882590
Change-Id: Ib71a6cec939288498e48736f129fbfdacaabe9da
(cherry picked from commit 6f58af1ae39b4151db5feaa72deecafb9365ca16)
(cherry picked from commit b5e541a6284200d28c7e6298ec46cb1f2f1eb9b9)
(cherry picked from commit b252cb801d547c9a9717d705303c3206a079c27f)

subject: Remove elementtree deprecated methods
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 09:36:11.000000000', 'message': 'Remove elementtree deprecated methods

All our supported runtimes [1] are compatible with the recommended
alternatives.

`Element.getiterator` [2] is deprecated since python 3.2 and will be removed
in python 3.9, these changes switch usages to Element.iter() [3]

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.getiterator
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.iter

Change-Id: Ice98ff5f59e02452c1392f3b2048929764630674
'}]
commit_message:
Remove elementtree deprecated methods

All our supported runtimes [1] are compatible with the recommended
alternatives.

`Element.getiterator` [2] is deprecated since python 3.2 and will be removed
in python 3.9, these changes switch usages to Element.iter() [3]

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-train
[2] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.getiterator
[3] https://docs.python.org/3/library/xml.etree.elementtree.html#xml.etree.ElementTree.Element.iter

Change-Id: Ice98ff5f59e02452c1392f3b2048929764630674

commit_message:
Fix horizon-nodejs10-run jobs

Tox is not anymore pre-installed on the OpenDev CI images.
The file package.json needs tox, install it to fix the job.

Install it via a pre-run playbook so that this is run in addition to all
of the playbooks of the parent.

Change-Id: Icf82fa96f7d90453f78cf564c847682a286ed575
(cherry picked from commit 7cd0debebe1a300a96f8d0f21626793be0a0bc41)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Ida35e5f79ee17ef8ac6ea2186019ddd4040ec882

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I7b97fab683e45118327b93c776f8c487feab7374

subject: Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual
messages: [{'account_id': 31068, 'date': '2020-06-04 12:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2020-06-23 10:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-04 12:45:34.000000000', 'message': "Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/issues/286
[4] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/277

Change-Id: I444b5919817b6b5cde2165872293076aff6bf6e9
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/issues/286
[4] - https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/277

Change-Id: I444b5919817b6b5cde2165872293076aff6bf6e9

commit_message:
Ensure lanplus is unset when using redfish

This avoids the additional burden of having to explicitly add
'--ipmi-no-lanplus' to the generate fencing command.

Change-Id: I1eab370213ce8d1f71f70016b481128254cec046

commit_message:
Remove Validations Mistral Workflows

This patch removes the following Validations workflows:
- tripleo.validations.list_groups
- tripleo.validations.list_validations
- tripleo.validations.run_validation
- tripleo.validations.upload

The following workflows still remain in charge and will be migrated
in a follow up patch:
- tripleo.validation.get_pubkey
- tripleo.validation.get_privkey
- tripleo.validation.enable

Depends-On: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/23700/
Change-Id: Ie36926e47cc46d5852a098f9e583169e7b1dcd7d
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix fast-track deployment after discovery/inspection

The inspection ramdisk configuration does not include ipa-api-url,
so deployment/cleaning won't start without a reboot.

Change-Id: I90149a522d6879bd5c2271bf3265ca7897233e1b
(cherry picked from commit 835a4873c0dd5ab5f465e70fde35643655b99119)

subject: Failed to discover the volumes on ppc64le
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-23 10:42:39.000000000', 'message': "Failed to discover the volumes on ppc64le

On ppc64le volumes are not discovered on running cinder backup commands.
In the backup logs the following error message is seen:
    _get_host_devices() missing 1 required positional argument:'lun'

Have added additional methods :
    __get_possible_volume_paths()
    __get_possible_paths_by_wwn()

Also modified the _get_host_devices() method to:
    - add the lun argument
    - a check for whether the host is a standalone host using PCI or an NPIV guest using FC path
    - returning the host devices accordingly

Tested cinder backup-create with this change - successful.

Change-Id: Ie196fc449a1a2f3fc7897efd7f2d2eedfeab231a
Closes-Bug: #1884707
"}]
commit_message:
Failed to discover the volumes on ppc64le

On ppc64le volumes are not discovered on running cinder backup commands.
In the backup logs the following error message is seen:
    _get_host_devices() missing 1 required positional argument:'lun'

Have added additional methods :
    __get_possible_volume_paths()
    __get_possible_paths_by_wwn()

Also modified the _get_host_devices() method to:
    - add the lun argument
    - a check for whether the host is a standalone host using PCI or an NPIV guest using FC path
    - returning the host devices accordingly

Tested cinder backup-create with this change - successful.

Change-Id: Ie196fc449a1a2f3fc7897efd7f2d2eedfeab231a
Closes-Bug: #1884707

[{'created': '2020-06-19 06:28:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Redfish handle no continuous override boot src

Some hardware Redfish services have dropped support for continuously
overriding the boot source when the boot mode is Unified Extensible
Firmware Interface (UEFI). See this discussion:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014543.html

A workaround falls back to one-time override, restoring it on every
reboot or power on. [1] However, it does not work, because, per the
Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) Redfish standard, one-time
override is disabled on the next boot cycle. [2] This fixes that by
explicitly setting the boot source override to one-time every time it is
restored.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007527
[2] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/ComputerSystem.v1_11_0.json

# Conflicts:
#	ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/management.py

'}]
commit_message:
Fix Redfish handle no continuous override boot src

Some hardware Redfish services have dropped support for continuously
overriding the boot source when the boot mode is Unified Extensible
Firmware Interface (UEFI). See this discussion:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014543.html

A workaround falls back to one-time override, restoring it on every
reboot or power on. [1] However, it does not work, because, per the
Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF) Redfish standard, one-time
override is disabled on the next boot cycle. [2] This fixes that by
explicitly setting the boot source override to one-time every time it is
restored.

[1] https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2007527
[2] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/ComputerSystem.v1_11_0.json

# Conflicts:
#	ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/management.py

Story: 2007733
Task: 39897
Change-Id: I6f5a11a77e7b16cdd0d837fdec51c3e9aeea9a31
(cherry picked from commit c56777929adf9c380f20777f5b3bfc37370b859e)

commit_message:
Allow node vif attach to specify port_uuid or portgroup_uuid

Update the function that checks for free ports/portgroups to
accept a port_like_obj_id parameter to match. This parameter
comes from the vif_info dictionary.

Story: 2007723
Task: 39872

Change-Id: I82efa90994325aa37cca865920d656f510a691b2

anymore.

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Remove babel.cfg as well, this is the default role and not needed
anymore.

Change-Id: Ib240beb075ef8db5ba659dae8487b85d59efb355

Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints and requirements

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints and requirements.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I310cb8deafdd85498d3f425257506e11332c298c

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I3c11cfe1e5e87cd74e2b679aac906898ffdb1b27

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Iccb1384832b5f0892ddc3e5c2adec20e312add6a

commit_message:
Cleanup py27 support

Make a few cleanups:
- Remove python 2.7 stanza from setup.py
- Add requires on python >= 3.6 to setup.cfg so that pypi and pip
  know about the requirement
- Update classifiers
- Update requirements, no need for python_version anymore

Change-Id: I051224a8a943bc0fe83cc507538d888aeff5af8d

commit_message:
Add ensure-virtualenv for legacy multinode jobs

legacy multinode jobs are failing with virtualenv error[1] on subnode.
 /opt/stack/new/devstack/lib/infra: line 32: virtualenv: command not found

primary node is all good as devstack-gate install the virtualenv but
for subnode no one install it nor devstack neither devstack-gate.

This is happening in py2 version of jobs like nova-live-migration on
stable/train and stable/stein gate. Also grenade multinode py2 jobs.

Till those jobs moved to zuulv3 native which is targetted for this cycle,
let's install virtualenv for them.
[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/61558c18919142a3b3973c09989384b1/log/logs/subnode-2/devstacklog.txt#2677

Change-Id: I706ee6dee23decd34b23f99b7e5d88810f939050

commit_message:
Disable Sahara in scenario003-standalone

Sahara service is deprecated in TripleO and won't be tested anymore to
align with what is delivered downstream.
In the new container image tooling, we don't ship sahara images simply because
we don't have users and won't continue to support it's deployment in the
future.

Change-Id: If1c621b45718475578dca390c45c0e23d1f3d7bc
(cherry picked from commit 03285912fcc784a971c206f44584b096e28ba14c)

[{'created': '2020-06-11 16:10:21.000000000', 'message': 'Clarify health monitor behavior

The basic cookbook document implied that pools without a health
monitor would eventually remove a failed member from the pool.
This will not happen as if there is not health monitor, the members
are assumed as ONLINE.

Change-Id: I6c52f163d8ac0456b4faf7d9bf5cc4a19ee6eeb7
'}]
commit_message:
Clarify health monitor behavior

The basic cookbook document implied that pools without a health
monitor would eventually remove a failed member from the pool.
This will not happen as if there is not health monitor, the members
are assumed as ONLINE.

Change-Id: I6c52f163d8ac0456b4faf7d9bf5cc4a19ee6eeb7

subject: drop mock from lower-constraints
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-08 23:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-06-08 23:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-10 11:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-10 11:41:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Regenerating lower-constraints, this is actually incorrect. Mock is still being used by one or more of the dependencies, so it does still get installed. So the entry really should not be removed.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-10 15:54:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Regenerating lower-constraints, this is actually incorrect. Mock is
 > still being used by one or more of the dependencies, so it does
 > still get installed. So the entry really should not be removed.

I seen a similar scenario on charm-* with charms.openstack that use mock but he doesn't have it in its requirements, so managed this use case by using depends-on, can we use a similar approach here?

Who in the stack still need mock?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-10 17:55:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Regenerating lower-constraints, this is actually incorrect. Mock
 > is
 > > still being used by one or more of the dependencies, so it does
 > > still get installed. So the entry really should not be removed.
 > 
 > I seen a similar scenario on charm-* with charms.openstack that use
 > mock but he doesn't have it in its requirements, so managed this
 > use case by using depends-on, can we use a similar approach here?
 > 
 > Who in the stack still need mock?

If a project is using mock but not including it in test-requirements then that is another issue. That's really a bug.

There are a lot of packages, openstack or otherwise, that use mock. So even though we don't use it directly here, with the goals of having a lower-constraints job, it should still be constrained there."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-11 12:06:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > Regenerating lower-constraints, this is actually incorrect.
 > Mock

 > >
 > > I seen a similar scenario on charm-* with charms.openstack that
 > use
 > > mock but he doesn't have it in its requirements, so managed this
 > > use case by using depends-on, can we use a similar approach here?
 > >
 > > Who in the stack still need mock?

 > test-requirements then that is another issue. That's really a bug.
 > 
 > There are a lot of packages, openstack or otherwise, that use mock.

I got it, thanks for the heads up"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-11 12:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-06-23 07:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: Ied00252f43bfd468dbf8c43cfe20d54adb2261f9

subject: Add ensure-tox to javascript pre roles
messages:
[{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 19:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 19:51:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-22 20:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

What is failing? horizon npm scripts work fine after the fix that I did recently...

Could you point to a recent failure, please?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-22 20:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Looking at your reference, I expect this to be fixed already in horizon master - and a backport of that is needed for stable branches.

but please give details of a failure to be sure.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 20:13:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Looking at your reference, I expect this to be fixed already in
 > horizon master - and a backport of that is needed for stable
 > branches.
 > 
 > but please give details of a failure to be sure.

Looks like the issue is that change was only to a couple of child jobs, so anything else using the base job still is missing the role.

This was seen in a patch that is trying to add an ironic cross job to requirements:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/91519dd380934013bdc8ed0cffc1cfb9

I'm still trying to wrap my head around the multiple layers of inheritance coming from different places, so it's possible I don't have it in the right spot either."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 20:13:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It does look like this fixes the issue though:

https://369f8c51f488988cf44a-3bb73954319247ffa3799ea16240aaf1.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/734463/5/check/cross-ironic-py38/8200f1b/'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-06-22 20:18:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> It does look like this fixes the issue though:
 >

Sorry, wrong link. It does appear this is still failing, so this isn't the correct fix either."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-06-23 07:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Fixed by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/737351/'}]

commit_message:
Add ensure-tox to javascript pre roles

Horizon and other UI projects call tox in their npm postinstall scripts.
This adds the ensure-tox role to the javascript playbook to make sure
this script doesn't error out by not finding tox.

https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/src/branch/master/package.json#L22

Change-Id: I181819a614816cba252eafe0f6ad2655b5edfa9a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I54aebb7d370f651642f40a69c27e6776d6093f1d

subject: Clean up some warnings
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-18 04:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-06-18 14:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

both changes seem reasonable - where did you see these "warnings" ?'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-18 17:59:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was trying out pytest as a test runner like

 pytest -Wall test/unit/

and seeing things like

test/unit/test_command_helpers.py::TestStatHelpers::test_stat_account_human
  /home/tburke/code/python-swiftclient/swiftclient/utils.py:221: DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections' instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated since Python 3.3,and in 3.9 it will stop working
    if isinstance(options, collections.Mapping):

test/unit/test_shell.py::TestParsing::test_password_prompt
  /home/tburke/code/python-swiftclient/swiftclient/shell.py:1605: GetPassWarning: Can not control echo on the terminal.
    return getpass.getpass()

test/unit/test_utils.py::TestLengthWrapper::test_segmented_file
test/unit/test_utils.py::TestLengthWrapper::test_segmented_file
test/unit/test_utils.py::TestLengthWrapper::test_segmented_file
  /home/tburke/code/python-swiftclient/test/unit/test_utils.py:544: ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.BufferedReader name='/tmp/tmpspjz2iel'>
    data = u.LengthWrapper(contents, segment_length, True)

test/unit/test_utils.py::TestLengthWrapper::test_segmented_file
  /usr/lib64/python3.7/unittest/case.py:628: ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.BufferedReader name='/tmp/tmpspjz2iel'>
    testMethod()

test/unit/test_utils.py::TestLengthWrapper::test_tempfile
  /usr/lib64/python3.7/unittest/case.py:628: ResourceWarning: unclosed file <_io.BufferedReader name='/tmp/tmpi90bqp07'>
    testMethod()

The getpass() warning actually causes a test failure since it no longer raises an exception :-/

There were a couple other issues, too -- I'm not actually sure how hard we want to try to make our unit tests runnable under pytest -- I mainly was poking at it because I knew it could catch & display the ResourceWarning at the heart of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/736401/ & https://review.opendev.org/#/c/721051/"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-06-23 04:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Ensure pip is installed locally

Recent changes to the base nodepool images removed the system-wide
installation of pip and virtualenv. As a result of this, some
requirements-check jobs are failing with an error that pip could not be
found.

This adds the ensure-pip role as part of pre_tasks in our
requirements-check playbook.

Change-Id: Id4969156383545eb94462677e3321b89c1160b48
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 74a5bed896893ecd3bdedb100439f773af7c7f5e)
(cherry picked from commit d303fe350d74d2d40aa5a591ee9d372a529d10be)

commit_message:
Ensure pip is installed locally

Recent changes to the base nodepool images removed the system-wide
installation of pip and virtualenv. As a result of this, some
requirements-check jobs are failing with an error that pip could not be
found.

This adds the ensure-pip role as part of pre_tasks in our
requirements-check playbook.

Change-Id: Id4969156383545eb94462677e3321b89c1160b48
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 74a5bed896893ecd3bdedb100439f773af7c7f5e)

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ie859ac36b1dcc4bc08e43eef3d6ed4399033f9f4

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I44e4eb34d8e4e30d7a3bb9e1361a259d8f6c9d19

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 00:23:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: If6bd35105d281ebf179dbdd4d3636a0419d5cd5c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: If6bd35105d281ebf179dbdd4d3636a0419d5cd5c

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: I5ef5b684f4c666e6d9f1168477f5b6c7799e9850

commit_message:
Remove docker_host configuration from env files

Docker host config is configured in release files and depends on
release, not on environment. It's configured in dependency patch
instead.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/737234

Closes-Bug: #1884371
Change-Id: I3e2b57c87e681fa5e1bb3502e3313cafffb20809

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 16:25:34.000000000', 'message': 'Use pyroute2 for SRIOV VF commands

Recent changes in some versions of iproute2 CLI output, have
invalidated the regular expression used to parse the "ip link"
output.

To solve this problem and avoid future ones, pyroute2 is used to
aetrieve the virtual functions information and set the VF attributes
(spoofcheck, min_tx_rate, max_tx_rate and link_state).

pyroute2 extended the "ip link" support to retrieve this information,
adding "ext_mask=1" in the get command. If no virtual functions are
present in this particular network interface, the added method,
"get_link_vfs",  will return an empty list.

The set commands can return a "InterfaceOperationNotSupported" in
case the operation is not supported. For min_tx_rate, if the driver
does not support to set a minimum bandwidth, a "InvalidArgument"
(from a pyroute2.NetlinkError(22)) exception will be raised.

Change-Id: I680da4f64bd114f1caecaaeedbf8a4b1915a0849
Closes-Bug: #1878042
(cherry picked from commit 7b501eeccefb92e79c2b830fa5085aa1e8c6bc5d)

commit_message:
Use pyroute2 for SRIOV VF commands

Recent changes in some versions of iproute2 CLI output (v4.18),
have invalidated the regular expression used to parse the
"ip link" output.

To solve this problem and avoid future ones, pyroute2 is used to
retrieve the virtual functions information and set the VF attributes
(spoofcheck, min_tx_rate, max_tx_rate and link_state).

pyroute2 extended the "ip link" support to retrieve this information,
adding "ext_mask=1" in the get command. If no virtual functions are
present in this particular network interface, the added method,
"get_link_vfs",  will return an empty list.

The set commands can return a "InterfaceOperationNotSupported" in
case the operation is not supported. For min_tx_rate, if the driver
does not support to set a minimum bandwidth, an "InvalidArgument"
(from a pyroute2.NetlinkError(22)) exception will be raised.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ip_link_support.py

Change-Id: I680da4f64bd114f1caecaaeedbf8a4b1915a0849
Closes-Bug: #1878042
(cherry picked from commit c5d8fd6329e405d1d584f4fedd7d0ede7da278da)
(cherry picked from commit 5df65489dc64fc7ec305a3c711bbb6c41ffe488b)

[{'created': '2020-06-22 16:32:21.000000000', 'message': "Add ensure-tox in functional job

neutron functional jobs run tests using the tox env.
Even tempest jobs need tox to be present to run the tempest
tests in venv. But functional job derived from devstack-minimal
jobs does not make sure tox is present or not. devstack jobs does not
mak sure that as those are not only used for tox run but also for
other integration testing.

Current neutorn functional job failure-
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/59865004855c404ab18f06fc0ec1d005

let's call ensure-tox role in job to make sure tox is present.

Change-Id: I9b4161946daa5863ddab94a57ad282e82bcf6e5c
Closes-Bug: 1884256
(cherry picked from commit 86e90bfce2169194524cabf4fe6eff5e232c7b91)
"}]
commit_message:
Add ensure-tox in functional job

neutron functional jobs run tests using the tox env.
Even tempest jobs need tox to be present to run the tempest
tests in venv. But functional job derived from devstack-minimal
jobs does not make sure tox is present or not. devstack jobs does not
mak sure that as those are not only used for tox run but also for
other integration testing.

Current neutorn functional job failure-
- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/59865004855c404ab18f06fc0ec1d005

let's call ensure-tox role in job to make sure tox is present.

Change-Id: I9b4161946daa5863ddab94a57ad282e82bcf6e5c
Closes-Bug: 1884256
(cherry picked from commit 86e90bfce2169194524cabf4fe6eff5e232c7b91)

commit_message:
Configure docker host for local container build

In case of job configured to build and consume containers locally,
use local registry instead of docker.io.
In periodic jobs continue to use RDO registry.

Related-Bug: #1884371
Change-Id: Idbf366e9af741e47b97fe8761eb6db1dbde98662

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-11 15:58:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add patch revision parameter to workarounds

The current workaround patch mechanism only allows for the
'current' (most recent) version of a patch to be used in
workarounds.

There are times when we may want to pin to a previous patch
set. This change enables that option.

According to [a] the revision ID can be:

- a legacy numeric patch number ("1" for first patch set of the change)
- the literal 'current' to name the current patch set/revision
- a commit ID ("674ac754f91e64a0efb8087e59a176484bd534d1")
- an abbreviated commit ID that uniquely identifies one revision of the change ("674ac754"), at least 4 digits are required

We also clean up two unused workaround templates.

[a] https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/Documentation/rest-api-changes.html#revision-id

Change-Id: I6382d139e123b745d0c23f3afd695dae316d861d
(cherry picked from commit 6fba346ad4c67ab67026e6ad87dca5311af7e92c)

Change-Id: I6382d139e123b745d0c23f3afd695dae316d861d

commit_message:
Add patch revision parameter to workarounds

The current workaround patch mechanism only allows for the
'current' (most recent) version of a patch to be used in
workarounds.

There are times when we may want to pin to a previous patch
set. This change enables that option.

According to [a] the revision ID can be:

- a legacy numeric patch number ("1" for first patch set of the change)
- the literal 'current' to name the current patch set/revision
- a commit ID ("674ac754f91e64a0efb8087e59a176484bd534d1")
- an abbreviated commit ID that uniquely identifies one revision of the change ("674ac754"), at least 4 digits are required

We also clean up two unused workaround templates.

[a] https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/Documentation/rest-api-changes.html#revision-id

Change-Id: I6382d139e123b745d0c23f3afd695dae316d861d
(cherry picked from commit 6fba346ad4c67ab67026e6ad87dca5311af7e92c)

commit_message:
metalsmith_instances: Handle an empty instance list

The dynamic concurrency change[1] causes an issue when the instance
list is empty because the thread pool is created with max_workers=0.

This change avoids this issue by exiting the provision function early
if the instances list is empty.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714735/
Change-Id: I0d3587b575b0d32563ef24c7b1316c0b173a4268

commit_message:
Add revert rule to check if share size and snapshot size are equal

When reverting, we should only allow the snapshot size and
share size to be the same, to avoid the situation of taking
a snapshot first, share and then extend, and then revert.

Change-Id: I1dcfbf399bebc19351115aa1641f5673b26ac723

[{'created': '2020-06-22 14:27:16.000000000', 'message': 'Check cherry-pick hashes in pep8 tox target

This adds a tools/ script that checks any cherry-picked hashes
on the current commit (or a provided commit) to make sure that
all the hashes exist on at least master or stable/.* branches.
This should help avoid accidentally merging stable backports
where one of the hashes along the line has changed due to conflicts.

Change-Id: I4afaa0808b75cc31a8dd14663912c162281a1a42
(cherry picked from commit aebc829c4e0d39a160eaaa5ad949c1256c8179e6)
(cherry picked from commit 5cacfaab82853241022d3a2a0734f82dae59a34b)
'}]
commit_message:
Check cherry-pick hashes in pep8 tox target

This adds a tools/ script that checks any cherry-picked hashes
on the current commit (or a provided commit) to make sure that
all the hashes exist on at least master or stable/.* branches.
This should help avoid accidentally merging stable backports
where one of the hashes along the line has changed due to conflicts.

Change-Id: I4afaa0808b75cc31a8dd14663912c162281a1a42
(cherry picked from commit aebc829c4e0d39a160eaaa5ad949c1256c8179e6)
(cherry picked from commit 5cacfaab82853241022d3a2a0734f82dae59a34b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 11:20:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes dnsmasq host file parsing with "addr6_list"

This patch fixes:
- The IPv6 tag added in the "host" file if is supported in
  dnsmasq. That shifts all other parameters in the register.
- IPv6 registers can have more than one IP address; in this
  case, the method "_read_hosts_file_leases" should return a
  tuple per IP address.

Change-Id: I4d0bc1eb9448366d8f1b2dacc9c5c2e4e6958253
Closes-Bug: #1884105
(cherry picked from commit 8eb4955bb62ec02b7a5cb725067c6193c37f9b0e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes dnsmasq host file parsing with "addr6_list"

This patch fixes:
- The IPv6 tag added in the "host" file if is supported in
  dnsmasq. That shifts all other parameters in the register.
- IPv6 registers can have more than one IP address; in this
  case, the method "_read_hosts_file_leases" should return a
  tuple per IP address.

Change-Id: I4d0bc1eb9448366d8f1b2dacc9c5c2e4e6958253
Closes-Bug: #1884105
(cherry picked from commit 8eb4955bb62ec02b7a5cb725067c6193c37f9b0e)

commit_message:
Implement tripleo-cross-tripleoclient-py38

tripleo-cross-tripleoclient-py38 is a new job that will run unit tests of
tripleoclient master against the current patch on tripleo-common, to
make sure a patch in tripleo-common wouldn't break tripleoclient.

Change-Id: I55505ba6ac2ca3df762b39c73f9e69520f93c638

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-22 13:25:32.000000000', 'message': '[tests] Ensure virtualenv is installed on the test host

We need virtualenv installed in order to prepare python virtual
environments on python2 hosts.

Change-Id: I88fc54769eff51cf07bc4496dc2a9aa538af5bb4
'}, {'created': '2020-06-22 13:26:41.000000000', 'message': "[tests] Ensure virtualenv is installed on the test host

As part of the cleanup test node python spec [1], the
pip and virtualenv elements were removed from the infra
image builds. Therefore, it's the zuul job itself the
one which needs to make sure that virtualenv is installed.

[1] - https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/infra-specs/latest/specs/cleanup-test-node-python.html

Change-Id: I88fc54769eff51cf07bc4496dc2a9aa538af5bb4
"}]
commit_message:
[tests] Ensure virtualenv is installed on the test host

As part of the cleanup test node python spec [1], the
pip and virtualenv elements were removed from the infra
image builds. Therefore, it's the zuul job itself the
one which needs to make sure that virtualenv is installed.

[1] - https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/infra-specs/latest/specs/cleanup-test-node-python.html

Change-Id: I88fc54769eff51cf07bc4496dc2a9aa538af5bb4

commit_message:
Add composible service for tls enrollment

This commit attempts to build out a composible service that enrolls the
undercloud as a FreeIPA host using an OTP. This is similar to what we've
done in the past for tls-everywhere except we're not using novajoin.

Change-Id: I770227b2f4f1ea447cf0138f57a6ed66c034d225
(cherry picked from commit 0e99ceda4bddf1498b03ab1ef1c2f927b6d7d1f2)

commit_message:
Add node-problem-detector chart

This adds a chart for the node problem detector. This chart
will help provide additional insight into the status of the
underlying infrastructure of a deployment.

Updated the chart with new yamllint checks.

Change-Id: I21a24b67b121388107b20ab38ac7703c7a33f1c1
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ia41326a601dfd72750bd81c3ebee9ec5884ad91b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
