commit_message:
WIP Rewrite legacy jobs to be more zuulv3 native

There is still some work to do. The playbooks themselves reference
WORKSPACE in places, which could be reworked. Also, it might be worth
considering whether the wrapper shell scripts which set variables and
then call playbooks could be zuul-aware playbooks? Or maybe that would
suck. It's tough to say.

Change-Id: Ia18d1084cfe1080dd60959a053d0a3e18d371e02

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-28 12:44:50.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I95a09d6ce195af3d483e170976f54353332bb190
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I95a09d6ce195af3d483e170976f54353332bb190

commit_message:
Add support of collecting logs from baremetal nodes

This change adds boolean option collect_remote_logs, which allows to configure
local syslog server for collect logs from baremetal nodes.
Logs are storing in /var/log/remote/%IP_OF_NODE% directory.
In case when remote_syslog_server configured, logs from baremetal nodes
forwards to that server too.

Added parameters for configure local/remote syslog protocol.
Added logrotate config

Change-Id: I752b43f7bd0645623ce319eb6e93465b24e530fa

commit_message:
Add support for uefi

Add config in dnsmasq.conf to support use uefi boot.
And add needed file ipxe.efi.

Change-Id: I584d1d957600f9ee398b989159e5532434c5433a
Closes-Bug:#1524845

Initial work to add ISC-DHCP

This is initial work to add support for dhcp servers other then dnsmasq.

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17789, 'date': '2015-08-21 09:13:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_roles.html
only use '.yml' for example, it don't meant that ansible playbook limited to '.yml' extension.

Actually, ansible playbook support both:
http://tsemerad.github.io/slides/ansible-intro#/yml-format

And yaml suggest to use .yaml when possible:
http://www.yaml.org/faq.html"}, {'account_id': 17984, 'date': '2015-08-21 09:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-08-21 09:55:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-bifrost-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/92/215492/2/check/gate-bifrost-pep8/db7d1ef/ : SUCCESS in 31s
- gate-bifrost-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/92/215492/2/check/gate-bifrost-docs/f4863e7//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 41s
- gate-bifrost-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/92/215492/2/check/gate-bifrost-python27/315b253/ : SUCCESS in 46s
- gate-bifrost http://logs.openstack.org/92/215492/2/check/gate-bifrost/68745d4/ : SUCCESS in 13m 28s'}, {'account_id': 1106, 'date': '2015-08-21 10:13:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Right, I'm talking about convention.
In Ansible, the convention is to use yml, not yaml.

Therefore, we should follow the convention used in the Ansible world by the majority of developers, the same way the Galaxy site recommends using yml.

This is not a bug to me, we shouldn't rename all of the sudden all the playbooks to yaml just cos in some other sites that are non Ansible they use yaml."}, {'account_id': 17789, 'date': '2015-08-21 11:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Example in ansible-doc don't means that this extention is recommended by ansible.

Actually, we have recommended extention(.yaml) in standard:
http://www.yaml.org/faq.html
> 1: Is there an official extension for YAML files?
>    Please use ".yaml" when possible.

.yaml is better choice than .yml, except we wish to run our program in DOS machine get from museum.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2015-08-21 15:36:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I have no real opinion on this specific instance, although I also know that we have .yaml file in roles that Ansible people would consider to be bugs, although we've navigated around that as we are forced, by Ansible's design to use .yml for certain key files.

Personally, I prefer '.yaml', however as noted above, we have to have some files as '.yml'.  I think this is something that needs to be raised to and corrected in Ansible.

I have no hard objection, so I believe this is going to turn into a desire for which method is the most popular.  I guess we can hold off on approving until September 1st to give adequate time for those involved with bifrost to express their opinions on the subject.

If it would help, we could also bring this up during the next Ironic meeting, and get input from the larger community.

For now, setting workflow-1 until we've had more time to discuss and for opinions to be expressed."}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2015-08-25 21:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

I think I have to agree with Ricardo here. The Ansible docs state this:
"...Ansible 1.8 and later support a new YAML format for the role requirements file, which must end in a yml extension."

for this reason I believe this patch should not land. Though I am open to more discussion on it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-10-06 18:42:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 05:31:43.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-06-22 08:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
rename vagrant.yml to vagrant.yaml

Yaml suggest to use .yaml when possible:
http://www.yaml.org/faq.html <http://www.yaml.org/faq.html>

This patch rename vagrant.yml to vagrant.yaml.

Closes-Bug: #1487340
Change-Id: I3788c8647f9cc4f15065f04c0fe653cf6743191f

[{'created': '2018-05-16 01:05:21.000000000', 'message': "pip version 10 will not uninstall system packages

System packages are often out of date compared to the
version available via pip.  So when pip needs to update
the package, it will receive the following error for example:
Cannot uninstall 'pyparsing'. It is a distutils installed project
and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong to it
which would lead to only a partial uninstall.

So remove the egg-info for a set of packages to trick pip into
thinking that the package has not been installed.

commit_message:
pip version 10.0.0b1 will not uninstall system packages

System packages are often out of date compared to the
version available via pip.  So when pip needs to update
the package, it will receive the following error for example:
Cannot uninstall 'pyparsing'. It is a distutils installed project
and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong to it
which would lead to only a partial uninstall.

So remove the egg-info for a set of packages to trick pip into
thinking that the package has not been installed.

Change-Id: I9b8e248546f18709f69394476f4ae69f827461e8

[{'created': '2018-10-19 09:00:08.000000000', 'message': 'tests: Always use virtualenv for tests

Hosts may come come with different packages installed which sometimes
conflict with what bifrost is doing. Some attempt to mitigate that was
made on 4d0c892e1054 ("playbooks: roles: Do not force dependency
upgrades") but it was reverted later on. Instead of adding a bunch of
tasks removing distro packages which may conflict with what Bifrost is
trying to do, lets put the entire Bifrost dependencies in a virtualenv
by default for the tests.

commit_message:
tests: Always use virtualenv for tests

Hosts may come come with different packages installed which sometimes
conflict with what bifrost is doing. Some attempt to mitigate that was
made on 4d0c892e1054 ("playbooks: roles: Do not force dependency
upgrades") but it was reverted later on. Instead of adding a bunch of
tasks removing distro packages which may conflict with what Bifrost is
trying to do, lets put the entire Bifrost dependencies in a virtualenv
by default for the tests.

Change-Id: I1961ef2f452b9d68cbc0314ad92e665dbc1901fd

The StarlingX docs site utilizes a theme variant within the
openstackdocstheme repo, but consumes packaged releases. A recent

commit_message:
Release openstackdocstheme 2.2.4

The StarlingX docs site utilizes a theme variant within the
openstackdocstheme repo, but consumes packaged releases. A recent
change merged to fix their site search, and the StarlingX community
would appreciate a new openstackdocstheme release to make use of it.

Change-Id: I0079eb9106677a2ad2c56c897a6b2d9299130bc6

commit_message:
fix(elements): fix nf_conntrack sysctl param names

Remove net.ipv4.tcp_tw_recycle because it has been
removed from kernel since 4.12.
Change for tcp_timeout_time_wait/tcp_timeout_fin_wait
to net.netfilter.nf_*.

Change-Id: I0e3cde5aad9e9b6007f975eafb0205e2912b19d3
Signed-off-by: Mikhail Ushanov <gm.mephisto@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I936f980f91ddc86e6e6d256b907085acd3c5be8d

commit_message:
drop mock from lower-constraints

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we don't need it
in lower-constraints.

These changes will help us to drop `mock` from openstack/requirements

Change-Id: I936f980f91ddc86e6e6d256b907085acd3c5be8d

subject: Stop to use the __future__ module.
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-02 18:23:02.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I5349bbf1f8c2018c4a6581cd1f15bfbaad00738d
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I5349bbf1f8c2018c4a6581cd1f15bfbaad00738d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-31 16:06:52.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I2dea97815d5f4cd40d120256e91787e078a9cc40
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I2dea97815d5f4cd40d120256e91787e078a9cc40

commit_message:
spec for add option to enable/disable a segment

If 'enable' of one failover segment is set False, all notifications
which belong to this failover segment will be ignored, so that
no recovery flow executes.

Change-Id: I418aaa9c34826dd908363d91e0df718f55721536
Implements: bp enable-to-segment

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 10:28:09.000000000', 'message': "hacking: force explicit import of python's mock

Since we dropped support for python 2 [1], we no longer need to use the
mock library, which existed to backport py3 functionality into py2.
Change Ib44b5bff657c8e76c4f701e14d51a4efda3f6d32 cut over to importing
the stock mock, which must be done by saying::

    from unittest import mock

...because if you say::

    import mock

...you may be getting the stock mock; or, due to transitive dependencies
in
the environment, the library mock.

This commit adds hacking check N366 to enforce the former.

This check can be removed in the future (and we can start saying
``import mock`` again) if we manage to purge these transitive
dependencies. I'm not holding my breath.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688593/

commit_message:
hacking: force explicit import of python's mock

Since we dropped support for python 2 [1], we no longer need to use the
mock library, which existed to backport py3 functionality into py2.
Which must be done by saying::

    from unittest import mock

...because if you say::

    import mock

...you definitely will not be getting the standard library mock.
That will always import the third party mock library.

This commit adds hacking check N366 to enforce the former.

This check can be removed in the future (and we can start saying
``import mock`` again) if we manage to purge these transitive
dependencies. I'm not holding my breath.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688593/

Change-Id: I79b0a084b8a99c54ce175a520e039e5572c5165a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-15 15:27:29.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Avoid unnecessary DB writes during agent liveness check

As stated in the bug description, there are many writes of the
agent liveness external_ids into the Chassis table. There was a
protection to avoid bumping nb_cfg too frequently.

The same protection is reused to avoid writing into the Chassis
external_ids.

This patch reduces the number of transactions to the SB database
and, therefore, the recomputations that it causes to ovn-controller
in all nodes.

Change-Id: I5db90fde8e7394772ec23c6384c711096c246621
Closes-Bug: #1883554
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Avoid unnecessary DB writes during agent liveness check

As stated in the bug description, there are many writes of the
agent liveness external_ids into the Chassis table. There was a
protection to avoid bumping nb_cfg too frequently.

The same protection is reused to avoid writing into the Chassis
external_ids.

This patch reduces the number of transactions to the SB database
and, therefore, the recomputations that it causes to ovn-controller
in all nodes.

Change-Id: I5db90fde8e7394772ec23c6384c711096c246621

commit_message:
Show container directly from DB

sometimes, we use "zun show" after "zun create" to see the container,
but the container was not created at that time in docker.
In the current process, the docker driver will set the
container error.

Closes-Bug: #1758253
Change-Id: I6ac7a0d8d8ad3ece9ac77797671018fdcb2dd456

commit_message:
Switch compute-kit jobs to 32GB nodes

We're running compute kit jobs on the edge of current flavor
capabilities and actually exceeding it with TLS enabled.
With this change compute kit TLS commit successfully pass check
jobs.

Change-Id: Ide1a1600f2e19fcb91ec7d90c8f316283b2d9697
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

Current octal notation is not supported by yaml 1.2 and may potentially cause compatibility issues. The safe way is to use a representation stable in both 1.1 and 1.2'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2020-06-22 00:07:02.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This may not be needed - I have cleaned up most of this in the TLS patches so they don't introduce octal. Existing problems will be addressed via other patches."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-19 22:55:34.000000000', 'message': 'fix(lint): relax yamllint

The draconian octal value in yaml enforcement only impacts the
specification of file permission - forcing the yaml author to do a
decimal conversion, while most Linux user is custom to the octal
specification. E.g., chmod 555 fileName. Changing this to a warning
instead to avoid folks getting caught in the conversion.

Change-Id: Ifc61ab20f047b662fa60032df6e98f24638f4dc3
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-06-19 22:56:39.000000000', 'message': 'fix(lint): relax yamllint

The draconian octal value in yaml enforcement impacts the
specification of file permission - forcing the yaml author to do a
decimal conversion, while most Linux users are custom to the octal
specification. E.g., chmod 0555 fileName. Changing this to a warning
instead to avoid folks getting caught in the conversion.

Change-Id: Ifc61ab20f047b662fa60032df6e98f24638f4dc3
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-06-20 00:04:24.000000000', 'message': 'fix(lint): relax yamllint

The draconian octal value in yaml enforcement impacts the
specification of file permission - forcing the yaml author to do a
decimal conversion, while most Linux users are custom to the octal
specification. E.g., chmod 0555 fileName. Changing this to a warning
instead to avoid folks getting caught in the conversion.

Change-Id: Ifc61ab20f047b662fa60032df6e98f24638f4dc3
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}, {'created': '2020-06-20 05:00:15.000000000', 'message': 'fix(lint): relax yamllint

Disallowing octal value in yaml file primarily impacts the
specification of Linux file permission. Ultimately, forcing yaml
author to perform a decimal conversion. Most Linux users are custom
to the octal (rwx) specification. E.g., chmod 0555 fileName.

This patch set disables the check to avoid contributors from needing
to an additional conversion.

Change-Id: Ifc61ab20f047b662fa60032df6e98f24638f4dc3
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>
'}]
commit_message:
fix(lint): relax yamllint

Disallowing octal value in yaml file primarily impacts the
specification of Linux file permission. Ultimately, forcing yaml
author to perform a decimal conversion. Most Linux users are custom
to the octal (rwx) specification. E.g., chmod 0555 fileName.

This patch set disables the check to avoid contributors from needing
to an additional conversion.

Change-Id: Ifc61ab20f047b662fa60032df6e98f24638f4dc3
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
resize: Send only nodes_to_remove and node_count

When resizing a NG we should strictly send the
desired node_count and the nodes_to_remove.
Otherwise the stack update operation may replace/rebuild
nodes or other resources.

This was the functionality with:
Id84e5d878b21c908021e631514c2c58b3fe8b8b0
But it was reverted with:
I725413e77f5a7bdb48131e8a10e5dc884b5e066a

Story: 2005266
task: 39860

Conflicts:
magnum/drivers/heat/k8s_template_def.py

(cherry-picked from 9f4c63a0df197405daa7bc3cd6939911ee3b7acf)
Change-Id: Ib31b6801e0e2d954c31ac91e77ae9d3ef1afebd2
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

A previous patch[1] missed batch_member_update when adding database
repository "get" method retries for new object creation actions.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix batch member create for v1 amphora driver

A previous patch[1] missed batch_member_update when adding database
repository "get" method retries for new object creation actions.
This patch fixes batch member create to retry the database get call
when new members are being created via batch member update.
This issue only impacts the v1 amphora driver as the v2 driver
does not need to get these objects from the database.

Story: 2007581
Task: 39503

[1] https://github.com/openstack/octavia/commit/48e85569f7e43e3dd5f09fd1ef4cb165526a92cd

Change-Id: Ia3476ab7b24dc3fd6e29ff2abe6eb6bacd9908ed
(cherry picked from commit 630a4e6a3cb60a8edeb4d8ad4a9cd7b31b42469a)

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Live migrate remove rep vol from sg

Adding missing force flag during live migration of instance
with more than one replication device in its masking view.
The removal of replication enabled devices from storage groups
is blocked in certain cases and an additional force option
is required in the REST payload.

Closes-Bug: 1875432
Change-Id: Ieae62e12df3be5018f716225abb65cdaa78379d1
(cherry picked from commit 50fc5e3988210f31d4b8244be189882fc1693cd6)

[{'created': '2020-05-19 11:15:13.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - U4P failover lock not released on exception

During U4P failover, if the initial operation that triggered the
failover hits an exception it can leave the failover lock in place.
Any operations waiting for lock to clear will continue to loop in place.
Added additional lock releases in exception catches and also a maximum
time that the holding operations should wait.

Change-Id: I43319854df9597df791a83cb4c598db0db3caec7
Closes-bug: 1875640
(cherry picked from commit 4351ace84f4ffd87d78a58fac3dd2eda64d41ba1)
'}]
commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - U4P failover lock not released on exception

During U4P failover, if the initial operation that triggered the
failover hits an exception it can leave the failover lock in place.
Any operations waiting for lock to clear will continue to loop in place.
Added additional lock releases in exception catches and also a maximum
time that the holding operations should wait.

Change-Id: I43319854df9597df791a83cb4c598db0db3caec7
Closes-bug: 1875640
(cherry picked from commit 4351ace84f4ffd87d78a58fac3dd2eda64d41ba1)

commit_message:
Update the API audit map

Recent additions to the Octavia API did not update the Octavia API
CADF audit map. This patch corrects that by adding the new API
paths.

Change-Id: I22107317837e68e54a29f8a4051c464120b29809

commit_message:
Fix API audit CADF audit map for failover action

There was a bug in the CADF audit map file for the "failover" action.

This patch corrects the audit map file to handle "failover" correctly
and stop keystonemiddleware from raising an exception.

Change-Id: If3954ba34740e26937dba10bdd8061acde758c88
Story: 2007831
Task: 40116

[{'created': '2020-06-18 17:06:03.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fixes dnsmasq host file parsing with "addr6_list"

- The tag field should be parsed now
- IPv6 registers can have more than one IP address

TODO: better description, testing

Change-Id: I4d0bc1eb9448366d8f1b2dacc9c5c2e4e6958253
Closes-Bug: #1884105
'}, {'created': '2020-06-18 17:20:02.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Fixes dnsmasq host file parsing with "addr6_list"

- The tag field should be parsed now
- IPv6 registers can have more than one IP address

TODO: better description, testing

Change-Id: I4d0bc1eb9448366d8f1b2dacc9c5c2e4e6958253
Closes-Bug: #1884105
'}, {'created': '2020-06-18 17:53:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes dnsmasq host file parsing with "addr6_list"

This patch fixes:
- The IPv6 tag added in the "host" file if is supported in
  dnsmasq. That shifts all other parameters in the register.
- IPv6 registers can have more than one IP address; in this
  case, the method "_read_hosts_file_leases" should return a
  tuple per IP address.

Change-Id: I4d0bc1eb9448366d8f1b2dacc9c5c2e4e6958253
Closes-Bug: #1884105
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes dnsmasq host file parsing with "addr6_list"

This patch fixes:
- The IPv6 tag added in the "host" file if is supported in
  dnsmasq. That shifts all other parameters in the register.
- IPv6 registers can have more than one IP address; in this
  case, the method "_read_hosts_file_leases" should return a
  tuple per IP address.

Change-Id: I4d0bc1eb9448366d8f1b2dacc9c5c2e4e6958253
Closes-Bug: #1884105

Configure privsep in SR-IOV agent

With the introduction in [1] of commands executed under a privsep
context, privsep should be initialized first.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/#/q/6f7b88d0808bee36b9d089ce8d3c0f98ae0b2dea

Change-Id: Ifdb8ad910ff6ffb31668ebb1e97d885ee924b470
Closes-Bug: #1883757

commit_message:
Revert "Enable mod_wsgi in Nova API container"

Nova seems unstable under Apache, so we will continue testing and defer
to Victoria.

This reverts commit c7482778aa942fee15d7ba84fdff438cea132491.

Change-Id: Ic34163ab967f849e88ddb37e0c060659180bb0ac

subject: Remove translation sections from setup.cfg
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-21 07:58:43.000000000', 'message': 'Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Remove babel.cfg as well, this is the default role and not needed
anymore.

also remove Babel from requirements[1]
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: Ieb8ccc0da21f22b127c064cb200185d1f75a8354
'}]
commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Remove babel.cfg as well, this is the default role and not needed
anymore.

also remove Babel from requirements[1]
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014227.html

Change-Id: Ieb8ccc0da21f22b127c064cb200185d1f75a8354

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-11 19:56:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-06-21 06:29:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-09 15:41:57.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I094b30b9c6242634c2316e02f02424621fcb8097
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I094b30b9c6242634c2316e02f02424621fcb8097

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I25b044f6c34422f219420a3ba9f0cb9be4cac0ea
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Remove hooks

This extension point was deprecated in 13.0.0 (Mitaka) as it was
unmaintainable. Now, over four years later, it's finally time to remove
them. A combination of notifications, versioned or otherwise, and
dynamic vendordata should be used instead.

Change-Id: Idb9a0c06d8abdb158bcee5be12c35dcb67257e60
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-06-20 15:46:43.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Change-Id: I23bdb623c36732ac4a886ad22e8155763040dba5
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Change-Id: I23bdb623c36732ac4a886ad22e8155763040dba5

commit_message:
Add missing test bindep on openssl

nova.virt.xenapi.agent.SimpleDH._run_ssl expects the 'openssl' binary
to be installed. This method is also executed by unit tests.

Change-Id: I5b53e1a97811768c0bbe8f4bdac06591f3739c66

We previously fixed a bunch of places, but not quite *all* the places;
at the very least, some account-layer services (like the replicator and
auditor IIRC) could still bomb out -- and it's important that
replicators still respect fallocate_reserve!

Now, do the NicerInterpolation thing every time we call readconf.
Additionally, clean up the original fix to avoid globally
monkey-patching configparser.

Closes-Bug: #1872553

(cherry picked from commit 2854eddb4424327fc6dc9b7930fd2874b5b23df4)

commit_message:
py3: (Better) fix percentages in configs

We previously fixed a bunch of places, but not quite *all* the places;
at the very least, some account-layer services (like the replicator and
auditor IIRC) could still bomb out -- and it's important that
replicators still respect fallocate_reserve!

Now, do the NicerInterpolation thing every time we call readconf.
Additionally, clean up the original fix to avoid globally
monkey-patching configparser.

Related-Bug: #1844368
Closes-Bug: #1872553
Change-Id: I4512e686cde37930f0482909f537220a57fef76b
(cherry picked from commit 2854eddb4424327fc6dc9b7930fd2874b5b23df4)

commit_message:
Use python3 venv instead of virtualenv

tempest-tox-plugin-sanity-check job is failing due to missing virtualenv.
As the job is running on master only and we don't support python2 anymore,
this patch edits the tempest-plugin-sanity.sh script so that it uses
python3 venv module to create a venv.

commit_message:
Remove obsolete setup

The file openstack-common.conf is not used anymore, remove it.

Remove translation sections from setup.cfg, they are not used, see
https://docs.openstack.org/i18n/latest/project_setup.html#django-projects

Change-Id: I2442d3ce325620a56b6fa0591485c0331d9096c7
